question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final, will Denmark qualify for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Denmark qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Denmark participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If both Czechia and Denmark qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Portugal also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Czechia and Denmark participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? 

The resolution criteria for the outcome are as follows: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Czechia, Denmark, and Portugal all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all three of the following conditions are met: (1) Czechia participates in its respective Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (2) Denmark participates in its respective Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final, and (3) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If any of Czechia, Denmark, or Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given both Latvia and Australia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Poland also qualify?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where both Latvia and Australia have qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Under this condition, we then consider whether Poland will also qualify.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Both of the following must occur: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (b) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Poland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Latvia, Australia, and Poland all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Latvia, Australia, or Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

- For the outcome: Lithuania must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Resolves YES if Lithuania qualifies under these conditions, and NO if it does not qualify.

question.title: Will Slovenia, Lithuania, and Denmark all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

If any of Slovenia, Lithuania, or Denmark does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will USD be worth >= 145 JPY (yen) at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
[image]

Market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Given USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On August 9th, 2024, the USD/JPY exchange rate closes at or above 145 JPY as listed on Yahoo! Finance. 

Then, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle?

For the condition to hold, the USD/JPY exchange rate must be at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024.

For the outcome to resolve as YES, Joe Biden must make an unambiguous and conclusive announcement before the specified date and time, indicating he will not accept the nomination. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, the outcome resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9, 2024 and Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) The USD/JPY exchange rate is at least 145 at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, and official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body:
(a) USD/JPY value will be determined by the close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.
(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.
(c) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on South Africa electing a president before July 1, 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?

Then, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15? Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on South Africa electing a president before July 1, 2024, and the market getting at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as follows:

**Condition**: The condition is met if both of the following occur:
1. The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to credible sources.
2. The linked market has at least 377 traders before it closes on July 15, 2024, at 11:59 PM Pacific Time.

**Outcome**: If the condition is met, the outcome resolves to YES if the July 2024 Manifold poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

The Manifold poll asks respondents if weak AGI has been achieved, without providing a definition, allowing them to vote based on their own understanding. The poll opens on the 23rd of each month and closes on the 30th.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, and the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2024, (2) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. **South African Presidential Election and Market Traders**:
   - The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources.
   - The market linked [here](https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time).

2. **Manifold Poll on Weak AGI**:
   - The July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents. This indicates that at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that before June 1, 2024, one of the following events occurs: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), the Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC, the PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines, or the PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines? If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on both ChatGPT being available in the EU and diplomatic actions between the Philippines and China, will OpenAI publish an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, with at least >50% of the population able to use it. (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, where one of the following occurs: The Philippines expels or recalls a diplomat with the PRC, or the PRC expels or recalls a diplomat with the Philippines.

Given both (a) and (b) occur, will OpenAI publish a public report by June 30, 2024, with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models? If so, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, and (3) OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The question about OpenAI's ChatGPT resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) The question about diplomatic expulsions or recalls resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(3) The question about OpenAI publishing a report resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

This combined question resolves as **YES** only if all three conditions (1), (2), and (3) resolve as **YES**. Otherwise, it resolves as **NO**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he is dropping out and resigning, will Kamala Harris be president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. He does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July; an announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

Given this, will Vice President Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source for this outcome will be official information from the US government, but a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Given both Joe Biden drops out of re-election and resigns, and Kamala Harris becomes President, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out of the re-election and resigning before the end of July 2024, and (b) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024. This question resolves to YES if both of these conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden announces that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement suffices; he does not need to have formally resigned by then. (b) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting will be used as the resolution source. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

Then, is it true that diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is dropping out of the re-election and resigning before the end of July 2024, (2) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and (3) diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if all of the following conditions are met: 

1. Joe Biden announces that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement suffices; he does not need to have formally resigned by then.

2. Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting will be used as the resolution source.

3. Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris being the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Details for the condition: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question resolves negatively if Trump is not removed or blocked from any ballot by July 15, 2024.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP nominee and Donald Trump is removed or blocked from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President candidate, and (2) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? 

Resolution criteria:

- For the condition: Kamala Harris must be officially nominated as the Democratic VP candidate. Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, confirmed through official state announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports.

- For the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to nominate its 2024 presidential candidate. Resolves **No** if only one ballot is required.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee, (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(1) Kamala Harris: This condition will be satisfied if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this condition will not be satisfied. The nomination decision is final at the time of the initial nomination.

(2) Donald Trump: This condition will be satisfied if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements do not suffice. The condition will not be satisfied if these criteria are not met as of July 15, 2024. Legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date are not considered; the focus is strictly on the status as of July 15, 2024.

(3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This condition resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:

This is determined by the value reported on the chart for that date, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that at least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024? The poll asks respondents whether weak AGI has been achieved, without defining the term, and resolves to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses.

question.title: Conditional on both Trump's lead over Biden being between 3 and 4 points and at least 30% agreeing weak AGI is achieved, will Biden announce dropping out and resigning before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. (2) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce both that he is dropping out of the 2024 presidential race and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- For condition (1), Trump's lead must be assessed based on 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024.
- For condition (2), the Manifold poll must show at least 30% of respondents saying YES to weak AGI being achieved, based on the YES/(NO + YES) ratio.
- For the outcome, Biden must announce his intention to drop out and resign before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The formal resignation does not need to occur by this date, just the announcement.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be assessed based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on their chart for July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The question resolves positively if Trump's lead is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points. (2) The Manifold poll, conducted monthly, asks if weak AGI has been achieved, allowing respondents to use their own definitions. The July 2024 poll must have at least 30% of respondents saying YES for this part to resolve positively. The poll results are based on YES/(NO + YES) ratio, ignoring "no opinion" responses. (3) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

question.title: Given Biden remains President through end of July 2024, will OpenAI commit to no retaliation for public risk disclosure before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not affect this condition.

Then, is it true that before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle? This resolves as YES if both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Conditional on Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China in the context of Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Condition: Vivek Ramaswamy must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if, before August 1, 2024, any of the following events occur, according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, the question resolves as **No**. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee and diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

2. Before August 1, 2024, diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China, as defined by the following events: 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given these conditions are true, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

For the purposes of this question, a "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g., if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this question resolves to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, and (3) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

2. Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

3. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this condition, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this condition is met) that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this condition. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this condition. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this condition.

If all three conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Joe Biden die before Saturday? question.body: (a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Then, will Joe Biden still be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Given both Democratic pressure on Biden to drop out and Biden's presidency by July end, will Trump gain 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, and (b) Joe Biden is still president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Then, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference must be >= 0.03. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July, and (c) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this condition is not satisfied.

(b) Joe Biden must still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024.

(c) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body:

1. Will Hurd is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is not based on who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election, but solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention.

2. The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for this resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

Then, given these conditions, will Mayor Kurt Wilson be physically present or confirmed via Zoom (with camera on and identification) at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024? question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024? (b) Will Mayor Wilson show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: 1) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and 2) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, or if he dials in on Zoom with confirmation of his identity (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). Resolves to **No** if he isn't there.

For (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for President and Kamala Harris picks Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as VP, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th district in the special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs: (1) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (2) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by her.

Then, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (2) Kamala Harris picks either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her VP, and (3) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(1) Liz Cheney must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(2) Kamala Harris must announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. The pick must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself.

(3) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

This conditional question evaluates whether Ron DeSantis will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, given that both of the following conditions are met: (a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024, and (b) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as YES if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Elon Musk will show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 and Linda Yaccarino will be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (b) Ron DeSantis will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:

question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024, and (b) the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) according to reports from credible sources.
