question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that there will be another Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee and there is another Democratic debate, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (2) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then, regarding the situation in Ukraine, it resolves as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

If the condition regarding Larry Elder and the Democratic debate is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Larry Elder will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and there will be another Democratic party presidential debate, and (2) Russia will have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all the following conditions are met: (1) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election, and there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. (2) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine. The question resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: If Kamala Harris becomes President by Friday, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This designation can be confirmed through official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Given this scenario, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Nikki Haley is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee, regardless of any other candidates or options that may be present.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris becoming President or Acting President before July 26, 2024, and Nikki Haley being selected as the Republican nominee, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, and (b) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, will a reliable media outlet cover the story of Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, (b) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) if Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(c) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by Trump's lead in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on July 15, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given this situation, will Joe Biden drop out or be otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time? Resolves YES if Biden drops out before this date, otherwise resolves NO.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, and Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose both of the following conditions are true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden drops out of the 2024 presidential race before July 20, 2024. Given these conditions, will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for P: 
- (a) Resolves true if on July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average.
- (b) Resolves true if Biden drops out before July 20, 2024.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if credible reports indicate an attack attributed to Iran within Israel's borders leads to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) Biden will drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Iran will carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

(c) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Given the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win at least 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the outcomes of two scenarios at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Suppose the following is true: A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means the same nation must win at least two of these events.

Then, the question asks: Will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

The resolution criteria for the second part: The market resolves to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. If confirmed prior to the end of the Games, the market resolves immediately to "Yes". Otherwise, it resolves to "No".

question.title: Given that both a single nation wins more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals at Paris 2024, will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question considers the scenario where both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics:
(a) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

The question resolves positively if the USA is the unique highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (1) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, and (2) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body:
This question resolves to Yes if all of the following conditions are met at the Paris 2024 Olympics: 

1. The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

2. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals, as determined by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable.

3. The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:
   - Number of Gold Medals
   - (Where Gold Medals are tied) Number of Silver Medals
   - (Where Silver Medals are tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then is the following true? Before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports, at least one of the following events happens:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

question.title: Given both Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 and diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 2024, (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, meaning the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China, meaning one of these events occurs: The Philippines expels or recalls at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC), or the PRC expels or recalls at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

Then, given these conditions, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? This resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th Amendment does not cause a NO resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 2024, and will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines. The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No. This question resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is met. If someone else is selected as VP, it is not met. The VP nomination is considered final at the time of initial nomination.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before July 20th. This could be by signing a letter or another form of collective action. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

question.title: If Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP and at least 5 Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Biden have a 45+ minute on-camera interview before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President, and at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collectively urge Joe Biden to drop out of the 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th. Given this scenario, will Joe Biden participate in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Kamala Harris must be initially nominated as the Democratic Vice President.
- A group of at least five named Democratic lawmakers must collectively act to urge Biden to reconsider his re-election campaign before July 20th.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024.
- The interview must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include podcasts, late night shows, or edited interviews like those on 60 Minutes.
- At least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person must be released.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP, at least 5 named Democratic lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. The resolution is based on the initial nomination, and any changes after that do not affect the outcome. (2) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). The group must act collectively, such as by signing a letter or meeting Biden in person. (3) Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. If all three conditions are satisfied, this question resolves to YES. If any condition is not met, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday?
question.body: This market will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET

question.title: Conditional on Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday, will a reliable media outlet cover Joe Biden's dropout at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Given this condition, we are interested in whether a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post will cover President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Maria Corina Machado must be imprisoned before the specified date and time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if a reliable media outlet covers the dropout at least 6 hours before the official announcement. The question resolves as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Given both (a) Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday and (b) Joe Biden's dropout is covered by reliable media at least 6 hours in advance, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 
(a) Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition is only relevant if Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given these conditions, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will both of the following occur: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday? (b) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (2) Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(1) (a) Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, must be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET.
(b) If President Joe Biden drops out, a big and reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post must cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition is only relevant if Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.
(2) Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Will Hurd being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. In this context, we want to know if there will be another Democratic party presidential debate. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Will Hurd must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise. 

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Will Hurd is the Republican nominee and there is another Democratic party presidential debate, will Kamala Harris become President by July 26, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Given these conditions, will Kamala Harris be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) there be another Democratic party presidential debate, AND (c) Kamala Harris be designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. (c) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used. If all conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring or killing at least one person (other than the terrorists) between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given this, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024? The question will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (b) there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024. 

Details for (a): Resolves Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Details for (b): Resolves Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Then, is it true that at least 24 world records will be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as Yes if 24 or more world records are broken during the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (b) An armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024, and (c) At least 24 world records broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about a terrorist act in metropolitan France will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The question about an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan will resolve as Yes if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) The question about world records at the 2024 Paris Olympics will resolve as Yes if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on there being another Democratic party presidential debate, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolves as YES. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both a Democratic debate and Greens-EFA win, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) There will be another Democratic party presidential debate prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, (b) Greens–EFA will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, AND (c) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en), credible media reports, and official declarations regarding the 25th Amendment.

question.title: Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday?
question.body: This market will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET

question.title: Conditional on Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Maria Corina Machado, the opposition leader, is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET. Then, will the S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Maria Corina Machado must be imprisoned before the specified time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for the most seats, both resolve as YES. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditionally on both Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before Friday and S&D holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, including scenarios where S&D is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution for this condition will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Given these conditions, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024? This referendum must have the consent of the London government and may be advisory, but not a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum without UK government permission.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday? (b) Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (c) Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This includes scenarios where S&D is tied for the most seats with another group. The resolution for condition (b) will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(c) There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Conditional on the Republican Party retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
This question considers whether the Republican Party retaining Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election could be related to Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024.

Condition: The Republican Party must win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. This is confirmed if credible sources report a Republican victory. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source will be used. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the condition is annulled.

Outcome: Biden is declared incapacitated if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, declaring him unable to discharge his duties, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of incapacity does not matter. Exiting office by other means or invoking Section 3 does not count.

question.title: Given the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election AND Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Resolution criteria for the condition: (a) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used in case of disagreement, and the election is held before January 1, 2025. (b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Biden must remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (2) Biden remains President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur:

(1) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used in case of disagreement, and the election is held before January 1, 2025. Additionally, the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(2) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Lithuania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

question.title: Given both Lithuania and Slovenia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Cyprus also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Lithuania and Slovenia participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Cyprus participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if both Lithuania and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final as per the EBU announcement. 
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Cyprus qualifies for the Grand Final as per the EBU announcement, and **No** otherwise. 
- If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all three countries: Lithuania, Slovenia, and Cyprus, participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?

(b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds her position before October 12, 2024. question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Kimberly Cheatle no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (c) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

(a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance. (b) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, must resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. (c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?

Suppose Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this is true, will Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: If Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee and Biden drops out before July 20, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) in a vote, according to reports from credible sources?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden drop out before July 20, and (c) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election, (2) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (3) during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. If any of these conditions are not met, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. 

Resolution criterion for this condition: This is based on the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that Chris Christie will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criterion for this outcome: This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined solely by the selection at the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual Republican nominee on the election day.

question.title: Given both Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 4 points and Chris Christie is the Republican nominee, will Trump's lead be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
2. Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, is it true that Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition, both of the following must occur:
  (a) Trump's lead over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.
  (b) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For the outcome, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI committing to "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" by July 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce he is dropping out and resigning before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle, with verification from Metaculus that the commitment is satisfactory to at least one member of righttowarn.ai. 

Given this, will Joe Biden announce, before the end of July 2024 Pacific Time, both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term? The announcement must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned by then. If the announcement is made, this resolves YES. Otherwise, it resolves NO on August 1st, 2024.

question.title: Given both (a) OpenAI commits to 'no retaliation for public risk disclosure' and (b) Joe Biden announces resignation by July 2024, will Iran initiate military action against Israel before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024. This means that before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:
- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

(b) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? 

For the purposes of this question, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces will not count.

(a) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024. This means that before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

(b) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

(c) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Conditional on the linked market getting at least 377 traders by end of July 15, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The linked market has at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the market has 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). Resolves NO otherwise. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Given both the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15 and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, will Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:

Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for P: 
1. Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.
2. Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on at least 5 countries winning their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal. Then, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the same Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to credible sources. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on 5 countries winning their debut gold and Kalenjin athletes winning both marathons at the 2024 Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the Games?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Olympics, at least 5 countries win their first-ever gold medal and both the men's and women's marathon races are won by athletes with Kalenjin roots. Then, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, and (2) both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur during the 2024 Summer Olympics: (1) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal and Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races, and (2) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal, and both the men's and women's marathon winners have Kalenjin roots according to credible sources. (2) A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Kimberly Cheatle must no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, due to resignation, being fired, or any other reason.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of acceptance. Resolves NO if such a statement is not made before the deadline.

question.title: Given both the head of the Secret Service resigns and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs:

(a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds her position before October 12, 2024.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Then, given these conditions, will Tucker Carlson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and **No** if any other candidate is selected.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(b) Will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(c) Will Tucker Carlson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024, AND 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, will ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
