Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Larry Elder will be the Republican candidate to run for the presidency in the November 2024 US election.

Then, we ask if the following is true: Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. This resolves as **Yes** if, for any reason, Sunak does not win a seat as an MP in the election. If Sunak is elected as an MP for any constituency, it resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome should cite credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate, if applicable.

question.title: Given Larry Elder becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This will be confirmed if credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency) state that Sunak was not elected.

Then, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 cycle? This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to this date, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Larry Elder becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, and (c) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This will be confirmed if credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency) state that Sunak was not elected.

(c) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will he be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, each closing on July 6. One poll asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks them to vote with a generic Democrat. This market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The calculation is based on the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. Then, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for witness tampering: The question resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Given Trump gains 3% among Manifold respondents against Biden and is charged with witness tampering in Georgia, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. There are two Manifold polls that close on July 6. One asks respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024. This resolves YES if Trump is charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024.

Then, given these conditions, will Joe Biden die before Saturday? This resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents and Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024 (2) Joe Biden dies before Saturday?
question.body:
(1) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This part of the question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Additionally, Donald Trump must be charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(2) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Given at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI has been achieved before July 23, 2024. This is determined by the July 2024 poll results showing a YES/(NO + YES) ratio greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats, or if they are tied for the most seats with another group, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on both (a) at least 30% of Manifold respondents agreeing that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (b) GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections.

(a) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024: Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding. Progress has been steady. The previous polls are referenced here:

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly underestimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th. This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

(b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: This question will resolve as Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?

The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

If the condition is not met, resolve N/A.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers it 6 hours in advance, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out, and a reliable media outlet such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This condition will not be met if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given this, will the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election? The question resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and “no” if/when they select a male presidential nominee.

question.title: Given both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman, then will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

(a) A big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout, if he does drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Then, will Kamala Harris announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, confirmed by herself before August 7th?

This question resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.
This question resolves NO if Kamala Harris announces anyone else as her running mate.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman? (c) Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
(a) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.
Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.
This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.
Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

(c) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Given an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will at least 24 world records be broken?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will at least 24 world records be broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria:
- Condition (P): Resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
- Outcome (Q): Resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. If fewer than 24 world records are broken, resolves as **No**.

If the condition is not met, resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis and at least 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal in tennis, and (b) At least 24 world records are broken. Given this scenario, we ask whether the United States Olympic Team will win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Resolution Criteria for the Condition: 
- Condition (a) is met if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis.
- Condition (b) is met if the number of world records broken is 24 or greater.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the United States wins more Gold medals than Silver medals.
- Resolves NO if they do not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, (2) At least 24 world records are broken, (3) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis, (2) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater, (3) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Iran initiate a military response before August 13th, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between the BSE SENSEX closing value and Iran's potential military action against Israel.

Condition: The closing value of the BSE SENSEX must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

Outcome: Resolves to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Military action is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli territory, officially acknowledged by Iran or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory are considered. Proxy attacks do not count. Resolves to "No" otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

question.title: Given both BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Iran initiates military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, will a Trump family member be the Republican nominee in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
2. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This includes any use of force executed by Iran that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory count, not attacks by proxy forces.

Given these conditions, will a member of the Trump family (Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump) be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024? (c) Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as "Yes" if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000.

(b) This question resolves as "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" includes any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting, such as airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions do not count. Only actions explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, count. Attacks by proxy forces do not count.

(c) This question resolves as "Yes" if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

question.title: Given Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and 10+ Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out by July 20, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024, and (b) at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out according to the resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html.

Then, is Ted Cruz selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per the NBA's official records. Given this condition, we are interested in whether France will place in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must win the 2024 NBA Finals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: France must place in the top 5 in the Olympic medal table, calculated by the total number of medals and ordered by the number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.title: Given both the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. (2) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024, based on the total number of medals won, ordered by Gold, Silver, then Bronze. The Olympics must take place in 2024 for this condition to be valid.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The medal table is determined by the total number of medals won, ordered by Gold, Silver, then Bronze. The question resolves positively if the US is the unique highest ranked team, ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place before 2027, and negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention. (2) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. (3) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

question.title: If USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be > 3 and <= 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The USD/JPY exchange rate is worth 145 or more yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The exchange rate must be 145 or more yen per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Trump's lead over Biden must be between 3 and 4 points (inclusive of 4) in the 538 national polling average on July 15, 2024, as accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Conditional on both USD/JPY >= 145 on August 9, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden being >3 and <=4 on July 15, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions:

(a) The USD must be worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, as reported by Yahoo! Finance.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Given that both conditions (a) and (b) are true, will any of the following occur before June 1, 2024?

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Resolution Criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if any of the above events occur before June 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. If none of these events occur, it resolves as **No**. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The market resolves according to USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance.

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(c) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: GIVEN Joe Biden announces dropping out and resigning, will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is both dropping out of the presidential race and resigning from the presidency. This announcement must be made in Pacific Time by the end of July 2024, but the actual resignation does not need to occur by then. 

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will announce her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7th, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Joe Biden makes the specified announcements by the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time.
- The outcome resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces her running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and NO if she announces anyone else. The announcement must be confirmed by Kamala Harris herself before August 7th, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Biden resigning and Harris picking Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, and (2) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- Resolves YES if both (1) and (2) occur as described.
- Resolves NO if either (1) does not occur by August 1, 2024, or (2) if Kamala Harris picks someone other than Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro by August 7, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.
- Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, (2) Kamala Harris announces her VP pick as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro, and (3) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?

An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Resolves NO on August 1st otherwise.

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals

(b) The Miami Heat must be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

The question resolves positively if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.
Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% against Biden among Manifold respondents and Sunak fails in 2024, will Trump be blocked from any primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents; (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election.

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment? 

This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Donald Trump has a higher probability. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, resolves 50-50. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, and 538 projecting Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is according to the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

2. Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024, and will resolve when the July 20 datapoints become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Given these conditions, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and 538 will project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024; (2) Nigel Farage will be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves to "Yes" only if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024. This is according to the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. Additionally, Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024, and will resolve when the July 20 datapoints become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as "No" if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be annulled. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as "Yes" -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve to "Yes." If either condition is not met, this question resolves to "No."

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given that Biden drops out before 7/13, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his run as president before the specified time for this condition to be true.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. This is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before 7/13 and GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, and (2) GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or be tied for the most seats. Then, will Joe Biden still be president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024? Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president at that time, and NO otherwise. If both conditions are not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Joe Biden drop out before July 13, GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: (1) Joe Biden will drop out or be otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. (2) GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, or be tied for the most seats. (3) Joe Biden will still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. All three conditions must be met for this to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Conditional on Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Resolution criterion for the condition: If Biden appears in such an interview, this resolves YES; if not, it resolves NO.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: On June 1, 2024, the ISW map must show the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control for this to resolve YES. If these coordinates are not under Russian control, it resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024 and Russia controlling Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will he announce not accepting the Democratic nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (2) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be similar to Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he answered questions for ~70 minutes. The criteria exclude press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but include appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E (Chasiv Yar) as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control.

3. Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If all three conditions are met, the question resolves as YES. If any condition is not met, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given both (a) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(b) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

Then, given the above, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20? Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators will call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (c) Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(b) This question resolves YES if, at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, as reported by the New York Times interactive 2024 US elections page.

(c) This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Conditional on Russia having control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024. This is determined by the ISW map showing the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as 'Assessed Russian Control' or similar. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the seasonally adjusted Core CPI data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the exact value.

question.title: Given Russia controls Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control, and (b) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

Given these conditions, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, (b) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(b) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI's ChatGPT being generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, will Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it), and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, still resolving positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, will Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024? This resolves based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

question.title: Given that both OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring payment), with availability to at least >50% of the population, and (b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024 based on official results published on credible sources. Given these conditions, will the S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats, or ties for the most seats, after the elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Resolves as **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, (b) Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, and (c) S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) Jonas Vingegaard is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(c) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

The question resolves as **NO** if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.
