An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part as YES. Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

(2) Resolves YES if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this part resolves as NO.

(3) Resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Given the US wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Then, is it true that a terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given the US wins gold in both 5v5 basketball events and a terrorist act occurs during the 2024 Olympics, will a swimmer win the most gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and a terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The terrorist attack must be described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Both the US winning gold in both basketball events and the terrorist act must occur as described.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Resolves No otherwise.
- If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball and a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) a swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: Resolves Yes if all of the following occur: (a) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) a terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024), and the attack is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers, and (c) the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Resolves No otherwise.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

For the condition to be true, Tucker Carlson must be the nominee selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For the outcome to be true, the formal declaration under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment must occur before August 2024, regardless of the duration of the incapacity. Biden exiting the office by other means or invoking Section 3 does not count.

question.title: Given Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee and Biden is declared incapacitated, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where both of the following conditions are met:

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given these conditions, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? If more than one ballot is required, this resolves as **Yes**. If only one ballot is required, this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (c) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(c) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this condition is not met.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%? (i.e. "Fresh")
question.body:
"Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Given Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics. This means they are not allowed to compete under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russian athletes participating. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this condition is not met.

Given this situation, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? This means the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) must invoke Section 4 to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Given Russian athletes are barred from the 2024 Olympics and Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

(a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as Yes, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as No. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from the 2024 Olympics, Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, and Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ALL of the following occur:

(a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

(b) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(c) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

All of the above conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: If INC forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question explores the conditional scenario: Suppose the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections (expected in May 2024). Given this scenario, will any athlete run the Men's 100m race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63 seconds, breaking the Olympic record, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources? The resolution criteria for the condition are that the INC forms the government, and for the outcome, the Men's 100m dash time must be faster than 9.63 seconds.

question.title: Given that INC forms the government after the next Indian general election and the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics breaks the Olympic record, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. (b) Any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

Then, will a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injure and/or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024)?

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) INC forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, (b) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, and (c) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This resolves as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

(b) This resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this resolves as **No**.

(c) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on at least 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics. In this context, we want to know if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) will win gold in more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Resolves as **Yes** if the same NOC wins at least two of these events.

question.title: Given both (a) at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal and (b) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true at the 2024 Paris Olympics:

1. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal, as confirmed by credible sources.

2. Women's teams representing the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win gold in more than one of the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Given these conditions, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

question.title: Will all of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal, (2) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport, and (3) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

2. Women's teams representing the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win gold in more than one of the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means the same NOC must have won at least two of these events. If women's teams from eight different NOCs win gold in these sports, this condition is not met.

3. Both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

Resolution criteria for this condition: The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Then, is it true that the price of 1 ounce of silver will be above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com?

Resolution criteria for this outcome: The market resolves YES if the price is above $30.50 USD. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below, the market resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August 2024 and Silver closing above $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, meaning the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President. This must occur before August 2024 (Eastern time), and the duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count, nor does Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment. (b) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. The price must be strictly above $30.50 USD, not exactly $30.50 or below.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question resolves as YES if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before this deadline that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this question resolves as NO.

(1) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

The price will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below at that time, the resolution is NO. The question is specific to the price being ABOVE $30.50 USD.

(3) Resolves YES if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: If Joe Biden is still president by the end of July, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. Then, will the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Joe Biden must be officially president at the specified time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves “yes” if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Resolves “no” if they select a male presidential nominee.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden being president at the end of July 2024 and the Democratic Nominee being a woman, will South Africa elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores two separate geopolitical events and their potential overlap. Suppose the following is true: At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially the president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates have selected a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Given these conditions, will the South African National Assembly officially elect a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as 'yes' if both (a) Joe Biden is still president at the specified time, and (b) a female is the Democratic presidential nominee. 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves 'yes' if South Africa elects a president before July 1, 2024, based on credible reports. Resolves 'no' otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden will still be president by the end of July 2024 and the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a woman, (b) South Africa will elect a president before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as 'yes' if all of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States, and the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (2) The South African National Assembly officially elects a president before July 1, 2024, according to reports from credible sources. It will resolve as 'no' if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: If the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, will Kamala Harris be president by Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

Then, is it true that Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET? This will resolve as Yes if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before the specified time. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with credible reporting as a secondary source.

question.title: Given the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th district and Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree, unless no election is held before January 1, 2025, in which case this part is annulled. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4? For this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election and Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, (2) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if BOTH of the following occur: (1) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district, with Ohio State sources or statements used if popular sources disagree. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled. (2) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, with the primary resolution source being official US government information or a consensus of credible reporting. (3) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is reported as greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given another Democratic party presidential debate, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: There is another Democratic party presidential debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. 

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition resolves YES if there is a debate as described. Resolves NO otherwise.
- The outcome resolves YES if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 in 538's national polling average as reported on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: If both a Democratic debate occurs and Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for President in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) a Democratic party presidential debate, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(c) Resolves YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. This statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this condition, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The resolution will be based on the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

question.title: If Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, and the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024? The resolution source for this is https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators, the answer is YES. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination by July 15, 2024, the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (2) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (2) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. (3) If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, then this condition is satisfied.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dying before Saturday, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, as officially announced. 

Then, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Given Joe Biden dies before Saturday AND the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions: 

1. Joe Biden dies before Saturday, with an official announcement of his death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th.
2. The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, according to credible sources.

Given these conditions, will Biden drop out or otherwise be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time? If he does, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, and (c) Biden drops out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

(c) Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Conditional on Kamala Harris being the Democratic VP, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, will Joe Biden have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for P: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is true. If someone else is selected, it is false. Changes after the initial nomination do not affect this.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves YES if Biden has a higher probability than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024. Resolves NO if Trump is favored. Resolves 50-50 if odds are equal. The resolution source is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP and 538 projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. The nomination of Kamala Harris as VP will determine the resolution, regardless of any subsequent changes to the VP nomination. The resolution can occur immediately after the nomination. (2) On the day of July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. The forecast will be based on the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and the market will resolve once July 20 data points are available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, the nearest previous data will be used. If both conditions are met, the question resolves to 'Yes'; otherwise, it resolves to 'No'.

Given this scenario, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.body: This question resolves to 'Yes' if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President, and on the day of July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is projected to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast. The nomination of Kamala Harris as VP will determine the resolution, regardless of any subsequent changes to the VP nomination. The forecast will be based on the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and the market will resolve once July 20 data points are available. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, the nearest previous data will be used. (2) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Croatia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Belgium also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this condition, will Belgium also qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for Belgium: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given both Croatia and Belgium qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Estonia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Croatia and Belgium participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Estonia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if both Croatia and Belgium qualify for the Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia does not qualify, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Croatia, Belgium, and Estonia all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Both Croatia and Belgium participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

question.title: Will Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris?
question.body:
This market resolves to YES if Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this market resolves 50%/50%.

This market will close when the Men's Olympic Road Race starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and will resolve after the race.

question.title: Given Mathieu van der Poel finishes ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race, will Sifan Hassan win a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

question.title: Given both Mathieu van der Poel finishes ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race and Sifan Hassan wins a medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:

Condition 1: Mathieu van der Poel must finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this condition resolves 50%/50%.

Outcome of interest: Paris Saint-Germain must win the Final of the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA.

It resolves NO if the conditions are met but Paris Saint-Germain does not win. If either condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. This is determined by accessing the chart on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is it true that the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET? The four weeks are based on CDC's epidemiological weeks. The rate used is for all ages, races, and sexes, and the season is from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024. Data is considered after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 and hospitalization peaks align, will Ron DeSantis be the 2024 Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.
(b) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, according to the CDC's RESP-NET.

Then, will Ron DeSantis be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3.

(b) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. The 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. The question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections.  All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024)

question.title: Given BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential impact of BJP forming the government on the volatility of the S&P 500. 

Suppose the following is true: BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which are expected to occur by May 2024. 

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to July 20, 2023?

The resolution for the volatility index will be based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023 for a 'Yes' resolution.

question.title: Given both the BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 and the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: 
1. The BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, meaning a BJP member is sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the general elections expected for May 2024. This resolves as **Yes** only if BJP forms the government after the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022.
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Then, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024 (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 (c) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: (a) The BJP must have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections expected for May 2024. This resolves as **Yes** only if BJP forms the government after the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022. (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. (c) The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024. All conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be met for this question to resolve as **Yes**.
