question.title: Given the Silver closes above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The price of 1 ounce of silver closes above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Then, is it true that the Greens–EFA political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition P: The price of silver must be above $30.50 USD at 4pm EST on August 9th, 2024, according to Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 or below, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome Q: The Greens–EFA political group must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions resolve as Yes.

question.title: Conditional on both of the following occurring: (a) Silver closes above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, and (b) Greens–EFA holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by Kitco.com. The price must be strictly above $30.50 USD.
(b) The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, as determined by official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. In the case of a tie, this condition is also satisfied.

Then, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, according to the data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL using the exact (not rounded) value?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will the Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024. (According to Kitco.com trading price @ 4pm EST.) (b) Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (c) Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
(a) This market will resolve yes if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Easter standard time on August 9th 2024. The price of 1 ounce of silver will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Should the price be exactly 30.50 USD per ounce of silver at 4pm on August 9th the market will resolve as no. The question is particularly specific to the point ABOVE $30.50USD.

Should the price be at 30.50 USD or below 30.50 USD the market will resolve as a NO.

I will do my best to resolve this market on time, if it hasn’t been resolved by 5pm EST time on August 9th 2024, please comment and remind me to resolve the marketplace!

Thank you

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(c) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden still being president by the end of July, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. 

Then, will Meta publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Joe Biden is still president by July 31, 2024, and Meta publishes a safety report by June 30, 2024, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.
2. By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Given these conditions, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, any of the following occurs according to official statements or credible reports:
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) At 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (b) By June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (c) Before June 1, 2024, one of the following events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If any of these conditions are not met, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Georgia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Czechia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Czechia also qualify for the Grand Final? This resolves as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, it resolves as **No**. If Georgia does not qualify, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both Georgia and Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Netherlands also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Georgia and Czechia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. This means that both Georgia and Czechia have participated in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Grand Final.

Then, is it true that the Netherlands will also qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If the Netherlands does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Georgia, Czechia, and the Netherlands all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Georgia, Czechia, or the Netherlands does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: GIVEN Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. Then, is Donald Trump removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution Criteria for the Condition (P):
- Kamala Harris needs to be nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, the condition is not met. The condition can be resolved immediately after the nomination.

Resolution Criteria for the Outcome (Q):
- The question resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.
- This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP and Donald Trump is blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, meaning she is the initial nominee for the Vice President position by the Democratic party, and (b) Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This means that on July 15, 2024, official announcements, court decisions, or credible media reports confirm his removal or blockage, and speculative reports do not count. Given these conditions, will Donald Trump be charged or indicted with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if Trump is charged for any statements related to potential witnesses in the case *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before the specified date.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP, (b) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (c) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this part resolves to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this part resolves to no. The VP nomination is considered based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This part resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been removed or blocked based on official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports or unofficial announcements will not suffice. The resolution strictly pertains to the status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for subsequent legal changes after this date.

(c) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

For the combined question to resolve as "Yes," all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) must occur as described.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Conditional on Biden dropping out before July 20, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition is met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Biden dropping out before July 20 and Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024, seasonally adjusted, increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, (b) Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (c) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made, it resolves as No.

question.title: If both Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, official announcement before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic nomination for President. Then, will Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model be greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM?

Resolution criteria:
- For (a): Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is selected as the Republican nominee.
- For (b): Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability is >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

(c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model: Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Will Hurd is the Republican nominee, will Vivek Ramaswamy also be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Vivek Ramaswamy also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as Republican nominees, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This scenario is highly unlikely as typically only one candidate is selected as the nominee. The resolution criterion for this condition is that both individuals must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is the following true? The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election. This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected as the Republican nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Both Will Hurd and Vivek Ramaswamy are selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominees for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (2) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Conditional on the head of the Secret Service resigning, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds the position before October 12, 2024. 

Then, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?

Every month, a Manifold poll is posted to gather consensus on the progress towards AGI, asking simply "has weak AGI been achieved," without defining the term. Respondents vote based on their understanding. The July 2024 poll will resolve to YES if the ratio of YES/(NO + YES) is greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Given Kimberly Cheatle is no longer the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, and (b) at least 30% of Manifold respondents will agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. 

(a) This means Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will have resigned, been fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

(b) The July 2024 poll on Manifold will result in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, indicating that at least 30% of respondents agree weak AGI was achieved, ignoring "no opinion" respondents.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Kimberly Cheatle will no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024, (2) at least 30% of Manifold respondents will agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, and (3) Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

(2) Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady. The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly underestimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Conditional on the USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two sporting events:

1. **Condition:** The USA must top the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This occurs if the United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team based on the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, the condition resolves ambiguously.

2. **Outcome:** Resolves YES if the American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game.

The question asks: If the USA is the top-ranked team at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?

question.title: Given the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 AND the American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game, will the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) The United States Olympic Team is the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, calculated by the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals in that order, and (2) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game. Given these conditions, will the Milwaukee Bucks be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals. It resolves as **No** if any other team wins or if the Bucks are eliminated from contention. If either of the initial conditions is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game, AND the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if ALL of the following occur: (1) The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. (2) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game. (3) The Milwaukee Bucks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

The question resolves negatively if any of these conditions fail.

question.title: Will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15? (78 more!)
question.body:
Sorry to my extremely loyal followers, I’ve become embroiled in some market shenanigans, so I’m making this market.

(https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g)Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on the linked market getting at least 377 traders by end of July 15, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The linked market reaches at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time, as per the criteria specified in the market description. Given this, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The market must have 377 traders by the specified deadline.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The VXVCLS must be greater on July 20, 2024, than on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed's reporting.

question.title: Given both the linked market gets at least 377 traders by July 15, 2023, and the VXVCLS is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The linked market gets at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2023, and (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, as reported by the St. Louis Fed.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden or his campaign make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The linked market resolves YES if it has 377 traders before market close on July 15, 2023. The VXVCLS question resolves YES if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes an unambiguous and conclusive statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the nomination. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023, (2) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, and (3) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(1) The linked market will resolve YES if it has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 2023, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

(2) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve YES if the reported number on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the Miami Heat winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. Then, will the USD/JPY exchange rate be at least 145 JPY per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The Miami Heat must win the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves NO if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The exchange rate must be at least 145 JPY per USD at the close on August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given that the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals and USD is worth >= 145 JPY on August 9th, 2024, will BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA.
2. The USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 is greater than or equal to 145 JPY, according to Yahoo! Finance.

Then, is it true that the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The Miami Heat wins the 2024 NBA Finals, (2) USD is worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, and (3) BSE SENSEX closes > 75k and <= 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if all of the following occur: (1) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). (2) The USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 is greater than or equal to 145 JPY, according to Yahoo! Finance. (3) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

It resolves **No** if any of the above conditions are not met.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions: 

1. The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

2. The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) must invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Suppose the BSE SENSEX condition is met. Then, will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked as described before August 2024?

question.title: Given both (a) BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment before August, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true:

(a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
(b) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Given these conditions, will Vivek Ramaswamy be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if he is selected, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August? (c) Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two independent events:

1. **Condition:** The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. This resolves to Yes if the number of Gold medals is greater than the number of Silver medals.

2. **Outcome:** Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolves to Yes if Donald Trump is chosen as the nominee.

Suppose the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Then, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and Donald Trump being the Republican nominee, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if both (1) and (2) are true. If either or both are not met, the condition is false.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the categories indicating Russian control. It resolves as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. (2) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (3) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves No.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, is it true that Tucker Carlson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and No otherwise. The nomination is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points and Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee, will 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Given these conditions, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For this to resolve YES, the group must collectively ask Biden to drop out, such as by signing a letter or speaking with him in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Separate individual statements do not count. Unnamed sources are insufficient unless at least 5 names are confirmed publicly before the end date. If these criteria are not met by July 20th, the question resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: If Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

Then, is it true that credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels?

question.title: Conditional on Biden being declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment and Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will the governor of Gagauzia travel to Russia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial concerning payments to Stormy Daniels. 
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. 
(b) Resolves YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Then, is it true that the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, will travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial, and (c) Evghenia Guțul travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) Resolves YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(c) Resolves YES if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: If a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that Asa Hutchinson will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Conditional on both a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a woman?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Details for condition (1): The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Details for condition (2): This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Then, is it true that the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee will be a woman? The outcome resolves “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It resolves “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?
question.body:
(1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(3) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman: Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage th...D, before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25791/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Conditional on the US government ending its agreement with Verisign, will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for condition: This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Resolution criteria for outcome: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given both the US ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, and Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (with an official announcement before market close on Friday, July 26th). 

Given these conditions, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, (b) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, and (c) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

(b) Will Joe Biden die before Saturday? Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(c) Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but including appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes with at least 45 minutes of new footage, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 as per Yahoo Finance data. Then, will the seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL?

question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. For example, Biden's interview on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes, qualifies. However, an appearance with less than 30 minutes of interview footage, like his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, does not qualify.

(b) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, as per Yahoo Finance data.

(c) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.
