question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is not dependent on who is the nominee on the day of the election, but solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will Biden drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time? If he does, the outcome is yes. Otherwise, the outcome is no.

question.title: Given Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee and Biden drops out before July 20, will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, meaning he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee, and (b) Biden drops out of the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. Given these conditions, will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) Biden drops out before July 20, and (c) the Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: (a) Glenn Youngkin will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 election. (b) Biden will be considered to have dropped out if he is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (c) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on at least 20 House/Senate Democrats signing a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Resolves NO if only one ballot is required.

question.title: Given at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and a brokered convention occurs, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls happen between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. 

1. At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

2. Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024. This resolves YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Then, given these conditions, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024? 

This resolves YES if before August 1, 2024, one of the following occurs:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events occur before that date, then this resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, and (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
1. Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?

- This resolves to YES if both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This requires a letter (or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures) signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

2. Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

- This resolves as YES if before August 1, 2024, any of the following happen according to official statements or credible reports: (a) The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the PRC. (b) The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC. (c) The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines. (d) The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

This combined question resolves to YES if both of these conditions are met.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question combines two conditions:

1. **Condition**: Donald Trump must testify at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. This can be either in person or remotely, and must be reported by credible sources.

2. **Outcome**: Linda Yaccarino must be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024. This will be confirmed by official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

The question resolves as YES if both conditions are met as described. If Donald Trump does not testify, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Donald Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Linda Yaccarino being CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

Given these conditions, will at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if such a public letter is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 signatures would also suffice. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, (2) Linda Yaccarino is CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and (3) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Poland qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Malta also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Malta qualify for the Grand Final as well?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Poland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final.
- For the outcome: Malta must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. If Malta does not qualify, the outcome resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given that both Poland and Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Ukraine also qualify?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both Poland and Malta participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Ukraine participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if Ukraine qualifies, and as **No** if Ukraine does not qualify.

question.title: Will Poland, Malta, and Ukraine all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all three countries, Poland, Malta, and Ukraine, participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of these countries do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Conditional on the United States winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Resolution criteria for condition: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on the US winning gold in both basketball events and Biden not seeking the nomination, will Sha'Carri Richardson win gold at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur:

1. Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This means that the United States must win the gold medal in both the men's and women's basketball competitions.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

Given these conditions are met, the question is whether Sha’Carri Richardson will win a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Sha’Carri Richardson wins gold in any track and field event during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President (c) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
question.body:
This question resolves as Yes if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This means that the United States must win the gold medal in both the men's and women's basketball competitions. If either team finishes with any medal other than gold, this condition is not satisfied.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the specified time, this condition is not satisfied.

3. Sha’Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. This includes any event she competes in, such as the Women's 100m or the Women's 4x100m Relay, provided she is part of the lineup.

The question resolves as No if any one or more of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Conditional on both Joe Biden having a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024 and Mike Pence being the Republican nominee, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Resolution criteria for (1): Joe Biden needs to appear in an in-person interview/conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

Resolution criteria for (2): Mike Pence must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: Conditional on a swimmer winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win at least 21 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on the official medal tally by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Resolves No otherwise. If confirmed before the end of the Games, resolves Yes immediately.

question.title: Given both a swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true at the 2024 Paris Olympics:
(a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals. This means the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

Under these conditions, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics? 
The question resolves as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will both of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing?
question.body:
(a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals: The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events, and Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

(b) Russian athletes are barred from competing: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, did someone intentionally shoot at him on July 13th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, did someone intentionally shoot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th?

Resolution criteria for Donald Trump testifying: This resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial.

Resolution criteria for the shooting incident: Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

question.title: Conditional on Trump testifying at the hush money trial and being intentionally shot at on July 13th, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

(2) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Given at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?

There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and the other asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Conditional on both at least 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games and Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (b) Donald Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. 

(a) This condition resolves as YES if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

(b) The condition involving Manifold polls resolves as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in a poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in a poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close.

Given these conditions, will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, defined as an attack that injures or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony on 26 July 2024 and the Closing Ceremony on 11 August 2024? The event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, (b) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents, and (c) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll exceeds that in the second Manifold poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.

(c) A terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as No if any of the above conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the condition: This is based on the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, is the following true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU?

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, and the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, will Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview before end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The market resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

The interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (c) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (b) Credible sources report that before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. (c) Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, not including press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for P: Biden must drop out or be unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time, for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 for a YES resolution.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and Trump's lead is between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Given this, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average; (2) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time, AND Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(2) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

question.title: Conditional on Iran's Guardian Council including Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate, will 5 Dem lawmakers pressure Biden to drop out?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario: Suppose Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. Given this situation, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

For the condition to be true, Ahmadinejad must be included in the Guardian Council's list of candidates.

For the outcome to resolve YES, at least five named Democratic lawmakers must collectively and publicly urge Biden to drop out before July 20th, either through a signed letter or another form of group communication. If these criteria are not met, the outcome resolves NO.

question.title: Given both Ahmadinejad's candidacy approval and Democratic pressure on Biden, will Iran initiate military action on Israel by August 13th?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

2. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message.

Then, will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET?

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Iran's Guardian Council will include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran, (2) a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and (3) Iran will initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

2. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

3. Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Given both the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals and ISS advises against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will Donald Trump be blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true:

1. The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

2. Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

Then, is it true that, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "Yes" if Trump has been removed or blocked as specified, and "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election (c) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: 

(a) The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

(b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

(c) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.body:

Resolution criteria for the condition: For (a), a diss track must be released after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. For (b), Disney must announce a new night time parade at or before D23 2024, and it cannot be an existing parade moving to Florida.

Then, is it true that a terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: A terrorist attack must injure or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between July 26, 2024, and August 11, 2024, and be described as a 'terrorist attack' by an agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.body:
(1) Either Drake or Kendrick Lamar releases another diss track directly intended for the other artist after May 9, 2024, and before June 1, 2024. 

(2) Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It will resolve NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. The question will close on August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement).

(3) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap exceeding Apple's on July 17, 2024, will OpenAI commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.
