question.title: Will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on Tadej Pogačar winning the Tour de France 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve based on two conditions:

1. **Condition:** Tadej Pogačar is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

2. **Outcome of Interest:** There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

If the condition about Tadej Pogačar is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Tadej Pogačar winning the Tour de France 2024 and Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Criterion for condition: Both (a) Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024 and (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024, (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (c) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Tadej Pogačar is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024 based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) In two Manifold polls closing on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll facing Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll facing a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.

(c) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the nomination on the election day itself.

If all three conditions are met, the answer is YES. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: Suppose the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, ending Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. Then, will a person representing the Republican Party win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson, in 2024? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report a Republican win. If sources disagree, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Given both the US ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and Republicans retain Ohio's 6th district, will 5 Dem House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), and (b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. If popular sources are in disagreement regarding the election, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves as No.

Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)?

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, and (c) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), (b) Credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. If popular sources are in disagreement regarding the election, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled, and (c) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. If these criteria are not met, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

question.title: Conditional on Albania qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the pole vault outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given Albania qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the men's pole vault Olympic record is broken, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (1) Albania qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final as announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU), and (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, the men's pole vault Olympic record is broken with a clearance of 6.04m or higher.

Then, will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if a single NOC wins gold in at least two of the following women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It resolves as **No** if eight different NOCs win each of these events.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) The same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, water polo. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Given Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This is determined by comparing two Manifold polls which close on July 6, where one poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll must exceed that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The condition is met if this formula for the Biden poll minus the formula for the generic Democrat poll is >= 0.03.

Then, is the following true: France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves positively if France ranks in the top 5 in the medal table, calculated by the number of Gold Medals, Silver Medals (if Golds are tied), and Bronze Medals (if Silvers are tied). It resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.title: Given both Trump gains 3% among Manifold respondents over a generic Democrat and France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Olympics, will Venezuela publish full election results before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This means that the percentage of votes for Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. (b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning they rank in the top five based on the medal table ordered by the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals.

Then, is it true that the Venezuelan electoral commission will publish full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election before August 12, 2024? This means that credible sources report that any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results representing 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish, before August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM VET.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents, (b) France will place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) The Venezuelan electoral commission will publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) This question will resolve positively if France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

(c) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (parroquia, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: If "deepfake" is said in the CNN debate, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has occurred will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will testify at the hush money trial? This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given both a "deepfake" mention in the June 27 CNN debate and Trump's testimony at the hush money trial, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators mentions the word "deepfake." This is determined by Metaculus's Admins, possibly consulting CNN's official transcript.
2. Credible sources report that Donald Trump testifies, either in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Given these conditions are met, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics? The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Both of the following: (a) Trump, Biden, or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial; AND (2) USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Both of the following conditions are met:
   a. During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether this has happened will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript. If the word is not clearly uttered, the condition is not met.
   b. Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

2. The United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

If all conditions are met, this question resolves as **Yes**. If any condition is not met, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Israel qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Israel does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Israel qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Then, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024?

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Given both Israel qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Borussia Dortmund win the UEFA Champions League?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Israel qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, which means Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified; and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, with a positive value indicating a Trump lead. Then, will Borussia Dortmund win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, which resolves **Yes** if they win the Final on June 1, 2024, according to UEFA, and **No** otherwise?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Israel qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Borussia Dortmund wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
(a) Israel will qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final if it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified. If Israel does not qualify, this part will resolve as **No**.

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 if, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, the value reported for July 15, 2024, shows Trump leading Biden by more than 3 points but not more than 4 points. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(c) Borussia Dortmund wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League if they win the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.body:

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES.

Suppose the above is true. Then, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Given both (a) at least 20 Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination and (b) the head of the Secret Service resigns, will BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This letter must be signed before the end of Sunday, July 21st, and can be a single letter or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures. (b) The head of the Secret Service, Kimberly Cheatle, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer holds the position of director before October 12, 2024.

Given these conditions, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: If diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. Resolves as No otherwise.

question.title: Given diplomatic tensions and Biden's announcement, will Machado be imprisoned by August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two events both occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China happen before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports. This includes the Philippines or China expelling or recalling diplomats from each other's countries. (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive and unambiguous. 

Given these conditions, will the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024, at 00:00 VET? The question will resolve as YES if she is imprisoned by that date and time.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, (b) Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Maria Corina Machado being imprisoned before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) This part resolves as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(c) This part resolves as **Yes** if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

The combined question will resolve as **Yes** only if all parts (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: If at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024, will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 be rated >8.5 on IMDB?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Scotland hold an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. Then, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as YES if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified at the trial.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, and this referendum is officially sanctioned with the consent of the London government. It may be advisory but not a "wildcat" or unsanctioned referendum.

question.title: Conditional on both Trump testifying at the hush money trial and Scotland holding an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will there be a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.
2. There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. The referendum must have the consent of the London government and not be a "wildcat" or unauthorized vote.

Then, is the following true: 

Will there be a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41? A break is defined as any amount of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one. Resolves "YES" if there is a break after chapter 40, "NO" if there is no break after chapter 40. This will be determined by official release or known-accurate leakers posting any details about a break ahead of time.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and (2) there is a break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:  
(1) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.  
(2) A break occurs between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41, defined as any amount of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one. The question will close on the official release, or earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time.

Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.body:
(a) Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

(b) Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%?
This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th).

Details:

- I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).
- For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.
- "Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).
- "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(c) Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: Given the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season, will Biden drop out before July 20?

Outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, otherwise resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher one week after release (August 9th). The score used will be the integer percentage listed on Rotten Tomatoes.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Will both of the following occur: (a) Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season? (b) Will Biden drop out before July 20? (2) Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

(b) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

(2) "Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

question.title: Conditional on the US ending agreement with Verisign for .com TLD, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

question.title: Given that both (a) the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and (b) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The US government officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024, as determined by an official action from the US Department of Commerce (DOC). (b) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, independent of who is actually on the ballot during the election.

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria: Resolves Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, (b) Asa Hutchinson becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) The US government must officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024. This is determined by an official action from the US Department of Commerce (DOC).

(b) Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is independent of who is actually on the ballot during the election; the resolution depends solely on the selection at the Republican National Convention.

(c) Joe Biden must announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, and official, leaving no room for the possibility that he would accept the nomination. This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

question.title: Given both the Olympic men's pole vault record is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics and Tyson Fury defeats Oleksandr Usyk, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?

Suppose the following two events occur: (a) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning the winning height is 6.04m or higher. (b) Tyson Fury defeats Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion, which means Fury wins their bout before May 19th, 2024. If there is no fight, the condition is not met.

This will resolve as Yes if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control. It resolves No if the location is not under categories indicating Russian control.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) Tyson Fury defeats Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion, and (c) Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body: (a) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault resolves as broken if the winning height at the 2024 Paris Olympics is 6.04m or higher. (b) Tyson Fury will be considered to have defeated Oleksandr Usyk if he wins their boxing bout. The question resolves No if Usyk wins or there is a draw. If there is no fight between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is annulled. (c) Russia will be considered to have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, if, when accessed by Metaculus on that date, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control. The question resolves as No if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

question.body:
(a) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

(b) Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

This resolves as Yes if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(c) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

The combined question resolves as Yes if all of (a), (b), and (c) occur within their respective timeframes.
