question.title: Given Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom by D23 2024, will ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Disney announces a new night time parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024, and it is not just the relocation of an existing parade. Then, is it true that OpenAI's ChatGPT will be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves YES if Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. It resolves NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It resolves positively if more than 50% of the population can use it, even if unavailable in certain countries or to minors. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the service remains substantially the same, even if the name or website changes.

question.title: Conditional on both Disney announcing a new night parade for Magic Kingdom by D23 2024 and ChatGPT being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where two separate events both occur:

(a) Disney announces a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida at or before D23 2024. This excludes announcements of existing parades moving to Florida. The question will close on August 8, 2024, or earlier if an announcement is made prior to the convention.

(b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, meaning more than 50% of the EU population can access it without a VPN.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Disney announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, (2) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and (3) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(1) Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. This resolves NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. This question will close August 8 and will resolve at the end of the convention (unless it is announced prior to the convention, in which case it will close as soon as possible after the announcement).

(2) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it). If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(3) Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question resolves as NO if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: If 538 projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will a country outside Poland, Germany, USA, Sweden, England, or France win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight's election forecast projects Joe Biden as having a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. This is determined by the blue and red trend lines on their website for that date. The forecast resolves according to the data for July 19 as soon as July 20 data becomes available, or according to the nearest previous figures if no data is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET.

Then is it true that a country other than Poland, Germany, USA, Sweden, England, or France will win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship? This resolves Yes if such a country is the announced winner on the official site or social media of the organization.

question.title: Given both 538 projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and a non-major country wins the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024, and (b) a country other than Poland, Germany, USA, Sweden, England, or France wins the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship.

Then, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024? 

Resolution criteria:
- For (a): Resolves Yes if Biden is favored over Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast on July 19, 2024.
- For (b): Resolves Yes if a non-major country wins the WTC 2024.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if the July 2024 Manifold poll shows at least 30% agreement on weak AGI achievement before July 23, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday? (b) Will a country other than Poland, Germany, USA, Sweden, England, or France win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship? (c) Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

(b) This question will resolve Yes if a country other than Poland, Germany, USA, Sweden, England, or France is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

(c) Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

question.title: Given an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. Then, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Conditional on both an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, and Nvidia's market cap being larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Before June 6, 2024, there is a confirmed death among the armed forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between the two parties, and (b) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, according to Companies Market Cap, as checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Given these conditions, will the Philadelphia 76ers be crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA? The question resolves **Yes** if the 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals, and **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Before June 6, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024? (2) On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's? (3) Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: (1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties. (2) This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (3) The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Given Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will Ukraine qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday. This means there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Given this, will Ukraine qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ukraine does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday and Ukraine qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given these conditions, will the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E be under Russian control on June 1, 2024, according to the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map?

Resolution criteria: The question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine. It resolves as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday, Ukraine qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following occur: (1) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, (2) Ukraine participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (3) when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race is less than 9.63s.

question.title: Conditional on the men's 100m dash winning time breaking the Olympic record at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Czechia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, the men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s. Then is it true that Czechia will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race is less than 9.63s.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This outcome resolves as Yes if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as No.

question.title: Conditional on both breaking the men's 100m Olympic record and Czechia qualifying for Eurovision Grand Final, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, and (b) Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024. Given these conditions, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- (a) The winning time of the men's 100m race at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 must be less than 9.63s.
- (b) Czechia must participate in a Semi-final of Eurovision 2024 and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.
- Resolves NO if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, (b) Czechia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (c) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (a) The winning time of the men's 100m race at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 is less than 9.63s, thus breaking the Olympic record. (b) Czechia participates in a Semi-final of Eurovision 2024 and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (c) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This means the same NOC must have won at least two of the following events: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given Inflection publishes an external red-teaming safety report by June 30, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
For Inflection, the condition resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

The outcome resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

The outcome resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on Inflection's report and ID political group holding most seats, will stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Inflection publishes a public report with results from external red-teaming of their AI models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (2) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections.

Resolution criteria for these conditions: 
- For Inflection, the question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.
- For the ID political group, the question resolves as YES if they hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It resolves as NO for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition resolves as YES.

Then, is it true that the Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, departs the ISS by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024? The Starliner must undock from the ISS and begin its return journey to Earth for this to resolve as YES.

Resolution for this outcome is based on official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, or a consensus of credible reporting.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, (2) the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (3) the Boeing Starliner spacecraft depart the ISS with NASA astronauts by July 21, 2024?
question.body:
(1) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

(3) The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel. This resolves to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

Resolution sources include official statements by the European Parliament, NASA, Boeing, and credible media reports.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%? (i.e. "Fresh")
question.body:
"Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

question.title: Given that M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes score of at least 60%, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose "Trap" (2024) achieves a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% one week after its release, which would indicate a "Fresh" rating. This score will be determined by the Tomatometer score listed on Rotten Tomatoes as of August 9th, 2024, using the precision provided by the site (typically an integer percentage).

In this context, we want to know if Joe Biden will be projected as the favorite to win the US presidential election over Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024. This will resolve to “Yes” if Biden has a higher probability of winning than Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for that day, and “No” if Trump is favored. If both have equal odds, the outcome will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for this is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, the nearest previous figures will be used.

question.title: Given both "Trap" (2024) scores at least 60% on Rotten Tomatoes and FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% one week after release (August 9th), and (b) FiveThirtyEight projects Joe Biden as the favorite over Donald Trump on July 19, 2024, according to their election forecast.

Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? This resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, (b) FiveThirtyEight project Joe Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (c) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
(a) "Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page: This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal). For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films: "Knock at the Cabin": 67%, "Old": 50%, "Glass": 37%. The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions). Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

(b) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite: This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19. Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

(c) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Given Russia has control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories indicating Russian control. Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX, according to Yahoo Finance, be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000?

question.title: Given Russia controls Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and BSE SENSEX is between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024, will the US see its peak hospitalization rate within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under Russian control based on their defined categories, and (b) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000 according to Yahoo Finance.

Given these conditions, will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US for the 2023-24 season occur within four weeks (28 days) of the combined peak hospitalization rate for COVID, influenza, and RSV, as reported by the CDC's RESP-NET? The peak rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV must each be within this four-week period relative to the combined peak, considering the CDC's "epidemiological weeks." The 2023-2024 season runs from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024. Resolution will occur after data revisions and reporting delays, typically four weeks post the relevant week end date.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, (2) the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k on July 21, 2024, and (3) the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
(1) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:

- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Assessed Russian Control
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location

The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare
- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

(2) This part of the question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, being greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000.

(3) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: If the BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than $185,548,391, which is the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013)? The box office opening is determined by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

question.title: Conditional on both BSE SENSEX closing between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and "Deadpool & Wolverine" having a higher domestic opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k, and (b) the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than the combined openings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine". Then, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria: 
- For condition (a), the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, will be verified according to Yahoo Finance.
- For condition (b), the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" must be higher than $185,548,391, as reported by Boxofficemojo.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if both the men's and women's marathon winners at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, otherwise it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined? (c) Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: (a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000. (b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. (c) This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Malta qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between Malta's performance in Eurovision 2024 and the activity in a specific market.

Condition: Malta must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final for the condition to be true.

Outcome: The linked market must have at least 377 traders before it closes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves YES if this happens, and NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Malta qualifying for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the market having at least 377 traders by July 15, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two seemingly unrelated events and the outcome of the MLB All Star Game. 

Condition details:
(a) Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024: This will resolve as YES if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as NO.

(b) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15: Resolves YES if the market embedded in the provided link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

Outcome details:
Resolves YES if the American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game. Resolves NO otherwise.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, (b) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, and (c) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game?
question.body:
(a) Malta qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024: This will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

(b) The linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15: Resolves YES if the market embedded in the provided link (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

(c) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game: Resolves YES if the American Team wins the MLB All Star Game. I will not bet on this market.

Edit (about 3 minutes after question creation): I changed the title from "Will the American League Team with the MLB All Star Game." It was just a typo.

question.title: Will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

question.title: Given Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad as a presidential candidate, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran. This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

Then, is it true that Israel will expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Given both Iran approves Ahmadinejad and Israel expands invasion to Rafah, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following occurs: (1) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election, and (2) The Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024. Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, resulting in a brokered convention?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Iran's Guardian Council includes Mahmoud Ahmadinejad as an approved presidential candidate, (b) Israel expands its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024, and (c) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. (2) The Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024. (3) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Resolves YES if she appears in the movie in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. 

[image]https://people.com/will-taylor-swift-play-dazzler-in-deadpool-and-wolverine-8651310

question.title: Conditional on Taylor Swift cameoing in Deadpool and Wolverine, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Taylor Swift appears in the movie Deadpool and Wolverine in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will still be considered true if she is not credited on IMDB, as long as it is confirmed by independent sources. Given this, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024. Resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

question.title: Given both Taylor Swift cameos in Deadpool and Wolverine, and Biden remains President through July 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (a) Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character, confirmed by independent sources even if uncredited on IMDB. (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this.

Given these conditions, will Donald Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? This is based on two Manifold polls closing on July 6, where one poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot.

The market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift cameos in Deadpool and Wolverine, (b) Biden remains President through end of July 2024, and (c) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(c) Resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Manifold poll with Joe Biden on the ballot exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Will there be a red card in either semi-final of UEFA Euros 2024?
question.body:
Will a red card be shown to any player or member of support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games?

A red card is shown either for serious fouls/misconduct, or as the result of a player receiving two 'warning' yellow cards. 

The market will resolve YES if any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.

question.title: Conditional on a red card in either UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final, will ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Will a red card be shown to any player or member of support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games?

A red card is shown either for serious fouls/misconduct, or as the result of a player receiving two 'warning' yellow cards. 

The market will resolve YES if any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.

Suppose the above condition is true: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: If both a red card is shown in either UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final and ChatGPT is available in the EU on June 30, will the same nation win multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true:
(1) A red card is shown to any player or member of the support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games. This means any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.
(2) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access ChatGPT without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and it is available to at least >50% of the population.

Given these conditions, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This resolves as Yes if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in at least two of the women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) a red card be shown in either semi-final of UEFA Euros 2024, (2) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (3) the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(1) Will a red card be shown to any player or member of support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games? A red card is shown either for serious fouls/misconduct, or as the result of a player receiving two 'warning' yellow cards. The market will resolve YES if any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.

(2) Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(3) Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on at least 5 countries winning their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics, will Disney announce a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal according to credible sources. Then, will Disney announce a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024? The announcement must be made by the end of the D23 2024 convention. It will resolve NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention, or if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida.

question.title: Given that at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics and Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources. (2) Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. The announcement must occur between now and the end of the convention, and it must be for a new parade, not an existing one moving to Florida.

Then, will it be true that Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag? This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics, (b) Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom at or before D23 2024, and (c) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources. (2) Disney announces at or before D23 2024 a new night time parade at Magic Kingdom in Walt Disney World in Florida. The announcement must occur between now and the end of the convention, and it must be for a new parade, not an existing one moving to Florida. (3) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Inflection publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. Then, will there be a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention? Resolves YES if such a debate occurs, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Given both Inflection publishes a red-teaming report by June 30, 2024, and another Democratic debate occurs, will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Inflection publishes a public report with results from external red-teaming of their AI models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention.

Then, is it true that Liz Cheney will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as YES if Liz Cheney is selected as the nominee, and NO otherwise. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate, and (c) Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) For Inflection, this question resolves as YES if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise. (c) Resolves YES if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage th...D, before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25791/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Given the US government ends its agreement allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). Then, is it true that the United States will win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as Yes if the agreement is ended before August 3, 2024, and No otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Given the US ends its agreement with Verisign for .com and wins gold in both Men's and Women's basketball at the Paris Olympics, will a journalist or opposition politician be charged in connection with the Slovak PM assassination attempt?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, ending Verisign's management of the .com TLD, AND (2) the United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Given these conditions, will a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will be resolved as **YES** if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt. Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect. Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for .com management before August 3, 2024, AND the United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (2) A journalist or an opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as Yes if both of the following occur:

(1) The US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024, AND the United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Specifically:
   - The US Department of Commerce (DOC) must officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024.
   - Team USA must win gold medals in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics.

(2) A journalist or an opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024. Specifically:
   - Credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations must report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt.
   - Alternatively, relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) must issue a statement to that effect.

The combined question resolves as Yes only if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

question.title: Given Scotland holds an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, will Nigel Farage be elected as an MP in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government and not be a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum.

Then, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nigel Farage is elected as the MP for any UK constituency in that election, and **No** if this does not occur. If the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from major UK news sources or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Conditional on both a sanctioned Scottish independence referendum before May 3, 2024, and Nigel Farage being elected MP on July 4, 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true:

1. Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024. This referendum must have the consent of the UK government and cannot be a "wildcat" referendum.

2. Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK General Election on July 4, 2024.

Given these conditions, will at least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the Democratic National Committee's plan to virtually nominate President Joe Biden early?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a public letter is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also suffice. Resolves NO otherwise.

If either of the initial conditions is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as MP in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election, and (b) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** only if all of the following conditions are met:

1. There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

3. A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Given GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing Biden's early nomination, was Trump intentionally shot at on July 13th?
question.body:
This question examines the conditional scenario where both (a) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports, and (b) at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan for President Joe Biden before the end of Sunday, July 21st, as reported by credible sources such as Politico.

Within this context, we explore whether someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. The resolution is YES if such an intentional act occurred, and NO if it was due to accidental discharge or ricochet. The projectile must be plausibly lethal, excluding non-lethal items like BB gun pellets.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections AND at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and (2) Someone intentionally shoots at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: 

(1) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports, and at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan for President Joe Biden before the end of Sunday, July 21st, as reported by credible sources such as Politico.

(2) Someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th, as reported in credible sources. This does not include accidental discharge or ricochet causing something to shoot towards Trump.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?

question.title: Given both the Pandemic Agreement approval and EU tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap surpasses Apple's on June 28, 2024, and Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee, will Tyson Fury defeat Oleksandr Usyk?

question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC), (2) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) Tyson Fury wins the boxing bout against Oleksandr Usyk.
