question.title: Given Israel expands its ground invasion to Rafah and the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th district, will Donald Trump be removed from any primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024, as reported by the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) on its map at any of six specified locations surrounding Rafah; and (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, confirmed by credible sources or an Ohio State source if there is disagreement.

Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024? The removal or block must be confirmed by official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports as of that date. The question resolves as "Yes" if he is removed or blocked, and "No" if not. Reversals after July 15th do not affect the resolution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024, (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, and (c) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

(c) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions are excluded. Proxy attacks by forces like Hezbollah or Houthis are excluded.

(2) This market will resolve "Yes" if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm EST on August 9, 2024, according to Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 or below, it will resolve "No". The question specifically requires the price to be ABOVE $30.50 USD.

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This means that after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. Given this situation, will Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League? The question resolves "Yes" if Real Madrid wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. All other teams resolve "No".

question.title: Conditional on both an attack on the Crimean Bridge and a Real Madrid Champions League win, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge, and (b) Real Madrid wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. Given these conditions, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, (b) Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, and (c) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

(b) The question resolves "Yes" if Real Madrid wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams resolve "No".

(c) This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the Indiana Pacers winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. 

Then, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance? 

Resolution criteria: The first condition is met if the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals. The second condition is met if the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is within the specified range.

question.title: Conditional on both the Indiana Pacers winning the 2024 NBA Finals and BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

2. The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

Given these conditions, will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? 

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise. If either or both conditions are not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) both of the following occur: (a) the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals and (b) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k, and (2) there is another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(1) Both of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

(b) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

(2) There is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention.

If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on Google DeepMind publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Google DeepMind publishes a safety report and Disney announces a new Peoplemover, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest R-rated opening weekend?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a public report by June 30, 2024, with results from external red-teaming of their AI models for safety, and (b) Disney announces a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 2024, meeting specific criteria such as having views above Tomorrowland and certain naming or structural elements.

Given these conditions, will the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, surpassing $284.5 million globally? The resolution depends on reports confirming that it grossed more than this amount and is recognized by the Hollywood Reporter or equivalent as the record for an R-rated movie release.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, (b) Disney announces a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024, and (c) Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For Disney, this resolves as **YES** if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024. To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

(c) For Deadpool & Wolverine, this resolves as **YES** if the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: If Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the chart for that date on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will the US Core CPI for July 2024, as measured by the seasonally adjusted index, increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024? The data for resolution will be taken from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 on July 15, 2024, and the US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. (b) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, determined by data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL using the exact (not rounded) value.

Then, will the United States Olympic Team win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics? This resolves Yes if the USA wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, and (3) the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(1) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/). This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(2) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 will increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(3) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Moldova also qualify?
question.body:
This question considers the scenario where Slovenia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Under this condition, we want to know if Moldova will also qualify for the Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Slovenia's qualification: Slovenia must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

Resolution criteria for Moldova's qualification: Moldova must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Moldova does not qualify, the question resolves as No.

question.title: If both Slovenia and Moldova qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Slovenia and Moldova participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the condition is not met and the question resolves as N/A.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Slovenia and Moldova qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final (b) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Both Slovenia and Moldova participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) Team USA wins both gold medals in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Given both a Democratic group pressures Biden to drop out and Google DeepMind publishes a red-teaming report, will Israel carry out a deadly attack in Iran by May 1, 2024?

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: If Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: When comparing two Manifold polls, one with Joe Biden and one with a generic Democrat, Donald Trump gains at least 3% more votes in the poll with Joe Biden. The percentage of votes for Trump is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the gain is determined by comparing the results of the two polls. This condition will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Trump in the Joe Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more.

Given this condition, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? This question resolves as YES if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given both Trump gains 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden and the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will the head of the Secret Service resign within 90 days?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

1. Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This is determined by two Manifold polls closing on July 6, comparing Trump's percentage of votes with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot versus a generic Democrat. The market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more.

2. The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This resolves YES if credible sources report that, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, the Crimean Bridge is struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles posing a credible threat to the bridge's integrity.

Given these conditions, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

(c) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: If Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average. Then, does Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?

Resolution criteria for P: This is determined by Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves "Yes" if Real Madrid wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. Otherwise, resolves "No."

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden and Real Madrid's Champions League win, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Real Madrid wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League.

Resolution criteria for condition (a): This resolves as true if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024.

Resolution criteria for condition (b): This resolves as true if Real Madrid wins the Final of the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League on the 1st of June 2024.

Then, is the following outcome true: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, and (c) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) Real Madrid will win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League. The question resolves "Yes" if Real Madrid wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams resolve "No".

(c) The Pandemic Agreement will be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly. This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Given "Deadpool & Wolverine" has a higher domestic opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, will it have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
This question combines two aspects of the movie's performance:

1. **Condition**: "Deadpool & Wolverine" must have a domestic box office opening higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013).
   - This will be verified through Boxofficemojo.

2. **Outcome**: If the above condition is true, will "Deadpool & Wolverine" achieve the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
   - To resolve as YES, it must gross more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports from Hollywood Reporter or an equivalent publication, which should confirm it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

question.title: Conditional on "Deadpool & Wolverine" having a record-breaking opening, will Elon Musk attend Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: "Deadpool & Wolverine" has a domestic box office opening higher than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined AND has the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie.

This means that:
1. The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, the sum of the box openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013).
2. "Deadpool & Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend, setting a new record for an R-rated movie release.

Given this scenario, will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 as a guest on the official stage of the conference taking place on July 25-27, 2024?

question.title: Will "Deadpool & Wolverine" set new domestic and global R-rated opening records AND will Elon Musk appear at Bitcoin Nashville 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if BOTH of the following occur:

1. The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752, AND "Deadpool & Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports, AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release.

2. Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Conditional on Russian athletes being barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russians competing. This will be determined by the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, or if the Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this condition is not met.

Then, given this condition, will the Greens–EFA political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA hold the most seats, and **No** otherwise, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Given Russian athletes are barred from the 2024 Olympics and Greens–EFA hold the most seats in the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Les Républicains form an alliance with National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, meaning no more than 34 Russian athletes compete, and they do not participate under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, as determined by the official list of countries and athletes present at the Olympics or credible media reports. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this part resolves as ambiguously. (b) The Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, having the highest number of seats compared to other political groups, as determined by official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition is still met.

Then, given these conditions, will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election? This resolves as Yes if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between Les Républicains and National Rally, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this resolves as No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, (b) Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (c) the Republicans Party of France form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body:
(a) Russian athletes will be considered barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics if they are not allowed to participate under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For this condition to be met, no more than 34 Russian athletes can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this condition is not met. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this condition resolves as ambiguously.

(b) The Greens–EFA political group will be considered to hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections if they have the highest number of seats compared to other political groups. This will be determined based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition will still be considered met.

(c) This condition resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this condition resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, is it true that Doug Burgum will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question resolves as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. The question is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given both a Democratic brokered convention and Doug Burgum as Republican nominee, will the US end Verisign's .com agreement by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party has a brokered convention in 2024, requiring more than one round of voting to nominate their candidate, and Doug Burgum is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. 

Given this scenario, will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, (2) Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, this resolves as **No**.

(2) Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This resolves as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates resolve as **No**. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(3) The US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Suppose Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024. Will Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
Condition: Joe Biden must be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

Outcome: Real Madrid must win the UEFA Champions League Final on June 1st, 2024, according to UEFA. If Real Madrid wins, the answer is "Yes"; if any other team wins, the answer is "No".

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given Joe Biden is president by the end of July 2024 and Real Madrid wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, will the men's 100m dash at the 2024 Paris Olympics break the Olympic record?
question.body:

Then, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics break the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China, will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 1, 2024, diplomatic tensions escalate between the Philippines and China, resulting in either country expelling or recalling diplomats. This could involve the Philippines expelling a Chinese diplomat, recalling its own diplomat from China, China expelling a Filipino diplomat, or recalling its own diplomat from the Philippines.

Then, is it true that France will place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This question resolves positively if France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by the total number of medals won, ordered by gold medals, then silver, then bronze. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Diplomatic expulsions or recalls must occur as described before June 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: France must place in the top 5 in the Olympic medal table as described, or the Olympics must not occur in 2024 for an ambiguous resolution.

question.title: Conditional on both diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China and France's Olympic success, will the BSE SENSEX close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before June 1, 2024, diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China, and France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000?

Resolution criteria:
1. Diplomatic tensions: Resolves **Yes** if any diplomatic expulsions or recalls happen as described between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024.
2. France's Olympic success: Resolves **Yes** if France places in the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics based on the medal count criteria.
3. BSE SENSEX: Resolves **Yes** if the closing value on July 21, 2024, is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, (b) France places in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

(b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 
1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, this question resolves ambiguously.

(c) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

- P is true if the Core CPI increases by more than 0.1%.
- Q resolves YES if ISS advises against either Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election.

question.title: Given both a US Core CPI increase over 0.1% in July 2024 and ISS advising against Tesla shareholder proposals, will Ted Cruz be the 2024 Republican nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL with the exact (not rounded) value. (b) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

Then, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk (c) Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL with the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* either Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Criterion for condition (b): GUE/NGL will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections if it has the highest number of seats. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as YES. This resolves based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Portugal does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024)

question.title: Conditional on BJP forming the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional probability of Kalenjin athletes winning both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics, given that the BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: This condition is met if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, expected in May 2024. Any other outcome resolves the condition as No.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as Yes if both the men's and women's marathon winners at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots. Resolves as No otherwise.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given BJP forms the government in 2024 and Kalenjin athletes win both marathons, will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table in Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, meaning the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. This is for the election occurring after June 1, 2022, expected in May 2024. (b) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning both winners have Kalenjin roots.

Given these conditions, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics medal table? The medal table ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals, followed by Silver, and then Bronze Medals. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, the resolution is ambiguous. Otherwise, it resolves negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, (b) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
(a) BJP forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

(b) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

(c) USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024: This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the chart on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value indicates a Trump lead. 

Given this condition, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for ChatGPT availability: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. If unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain demographics, this will still resolve positively if at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models and resolves positively if the service is substantially the same, even if the name or website has changed.

question.title: Given both Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, and ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points. This is measured by accessing 538's national polling average chart on July 17, 2024. (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. If unavailable in certain EU countries or to certain groups, it still resolves positively if >50% of the population can use it. Given these conditions, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats, or if tied for the most seats, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. Resolves as **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (c) the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Biden remains President through end of July 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President.

Then, is it true that at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party will sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the end of Sunday, July 21st? This includes the possibility of multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures. If this condition is not met, the answer is NO.

question.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through July 2024 and 20 Democrats opposing early nomination, will Gamestop's market cap exceed Docusign's on June 28, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024; he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be sufficient.

Then, will Gamestop's market capitalization be higher than Docusign's on June 28th, 2024, according to CompaniesMarketCap? This resolves as YES if, on Friday June 28, 2024, CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Gamestop than Docusign, checked after 4:00 PM EDT (8:00 PM UTC). If Docusign's market cap is greater, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing his early nomination plan, and (2) On June 28th, 2024, Gamestop's market capitalization will be higher than Docusign's, according to CompaniesMarketCap?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET) AND a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. This resolves NO if Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this part to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this part resolves NO.

2. On Friday, June 28, 2024, CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Gamestop than Docusign, when checked by Metaculus after 4:00 PM EDT (8:00 PM UTC). If CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Docusign than Gamestop, this question resolves as NO.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve YES.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Anthropic publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, and (c) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) By June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (c) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means that at least one NOC must have won gold in at least two of these events. The question regarding the Olympics can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, AND the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined; (2) Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. (2) The domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. (3) Luxembourg participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For all other outcomes, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given this, will Francis Suarez be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention, and **No** otherwise. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on the eventual nominee on the election day.

   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

2. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if before June 1, 2024, one of the previously mentioned diplomatic events occurs. Resolves NO otherwise.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, and (b) Francis Suarez being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.
   If there are no such reports before that date, then this part resolves as **No**.

2. Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention). If Francis Suarez is not selected, this part resolves as **No**.

If both conditions are satisfied, the combined question resolves as **Yes**. If either condition is not satisfied, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Joe Biden does not accept the Democratic nomination, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. 

Given this, will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP? If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this resolves to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this resolves to no. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and is not affected by any subsequent changes.

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%? (i.e. "Fresh")
question.body:
"Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

question.title: Conditional on "Trap" (2024) having a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% one week after its release (August 9th). This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, based on the precision listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage).

Given this condition, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher on July 20, 2024 compared to July 20, 2023? This question resolves based on the reported numbers by the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023 for a YES resolution.
