question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that a terrorist attack will occur in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics? A terrorist attack is defined as an event that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), and is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers, occurring between, and inclusive of, 26 July 2024 and 11 August 2024. If no such event occurs, the answer is No.

question.title: Given Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for 2024 and a terrorist act occurs in France during the 2024 Olympics, will Nigel Farage be elected as an MP in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) a terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France, injuring and/or killing at least one person, between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, is it true that Nigel Farage will be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024? This resolves as Yes if Nigel Farage is elected as the MP for any UK constituency, based on credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources, or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. The question resolves as No if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be annulled.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election; (b) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics; and (c) Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
(a) This resolves as Yes if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) This resolves as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** in the event that in the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. 

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Given the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. 

Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? 

This resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOCs) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. 

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**. 

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g., neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receiving a CinemaScore of B or above, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

question.body:

(a) M. Night Shyamalan's film "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B or higher. This means it receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it would resolve NO if it receives a B- or lower. Night Shyamalan, with past CinemaScores for his films being "Split" - B+, "Glass" - B, "Old" - C+, "Knock at the Cabin" - C.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is based on the national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported by 538 on July 15, 2024, and accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, for example, Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden on July 5, 2024.

Then, did someone intentionally shoot a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th? This resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or bullet-like projectile at Trump on that date. Resolves NO if an accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump. "Bullet-like projectile" refers to something plausibly lethal like a bullet, not a BB gun pellet.

(c) Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

question.title: Conditional on the Indiana Pacers winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

Suppose the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals. Then, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

Resolution criteria for Biden remaining President: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: If both the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals and Biden remains President through July 2024, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?

(b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then, though a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this status. Given these conditions, will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director before October 12, 2024?

question.body:
(1) Both of the following occur: (a) The Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals: The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

(b) Biden remains President through the end of July 2024: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

AND (2) The head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 [scheduled](https://commencement.ucla.edu/schedule/ucla-commencement-schedule-alphabetical#college) for the following times and locations on June 14, 2024:

- 11 AM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 3 PM at the Pauley Pavilion
- 7 PM at the Pauley Pavilion

The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. 

This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online (i.e., without graduates, faculty, and guests attending in person).

question.title: Conditional on UCLA holding its in-person commencement ceremonies on June 14, 2024, will Borussia Dortmund win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

Suppose the above condition is true. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024? Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: If Biden has a 45+ minute in-person interview by July 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be >2 and ≤3 points on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
The question explores two events: 

1. **Condition (P)**: Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include appearances on a podcast, late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

2. **Outcome (Q)**: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election.

Resolution criteria:
- **For P**: Resolves YES if Biden appears in a qualifying in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. If no such interview occurs, resolves NO.
- **For Q**: Resolves based on the reported lead of Trump over Biden on the 538 national polling average for July 15, 2024, accessed on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

The question asks: Given that Biden has such an interview, will Trump's lead be within the specified range on the specified date?

question.title: Given both Biden's interview and Trump's lead conditions are met, will Finland qualify for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. 

(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this condition resolves NO.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for the combined question to resolve YES.

Then, is it true that Finland will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Finland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, AND (c) Finland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this condition resolves NO. 

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

(c) Finland must participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Finland does not qualify, this condition resolves NO.

All conditions (a), (b), and (c) must be satisfied for the combined question to resolve YES.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Conditional on the US winning gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, will the Netherlands qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold. 

Then, will the Netherlands qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If the Netherlands does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on both the US winning gold in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics and the Netherlands qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: 

1. Team USA wins gold medals in both the men's and women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics.
2. The Netherlands participates in a Eurovision 2024 Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.
3. Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

The question resolves as No if either the United States does not win both gold medals, the Netherlands does not qualify for the Grand Final, or Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. 

If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source for Biden vs. Trump odds will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, (b) The Netherlands qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (c) 538 projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Team USA wins gold medals in both the men's and women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympics. (2) The Netherlands participates in a Eurovision 2024 Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (3) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This forecast is based on the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's website for that date. The question resolves as No if any of these conditions are not met.

- (b) Resolves Yes if the US government ends the agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) the US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and (c) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

(c) Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle. This commitment must be a new level of commitment relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published, and it must be verified by Metaculus to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai.

Then, is it true that on June 28, 2024, CompaniesMarketCap will show a greater market capitalization for Gamestop than for Docusign, when checked after 4:00 PM EDT (8:00 PM UTC)?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: OpenAI must make a public statement indicating a new commitment to the principle, and Metaculus must verify satisfaction from righttowarn.ai.
- For the outcome: CompaniesMarketCap must list Gamestop's market cap as higher than Docusign's on the specified date and time.

Then, will Asa Hutchinson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024, (2) Gamestop's market capitalization is higher than Docusign's on June 28th, 2024, and (3) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following are true:

1. **OpenAI Commitment**: Before July 1, 2024, OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

2. **Market Capitalization**: On Friday June 28, 2024, CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Gamestop than Docusign, when checked by Metaculus after 4:00 PM EDT (8:00 PM UTC). If CompaniesMarketCap shows a greater market cap for Docusign than Gamestop, this part of the question resolves as **No**. Gamestop's page can be accessed [here](https://companiesmarketcap.com/gamestop/marketcap/). Docusign's page can be accessed [here](https://companiesmarketcap.com/docusign/marketcap/).

3. **Republican Nominee**: Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Taylor Swift cameos in Deadpool and Wolverine, will it have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Taylor Swift appears in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. This will still be considered true if she is not credited on IMDB, but it is confirmed by independent sources.

Given this, will the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie? 

The movie needs to gross more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) must report it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The BoxOfficeMojo numbers are unofficial until confirmed by Hollywood press.

Given these conditions, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024?

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Both (a) Taylor Swift will cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine AND (b) Deadpool & Wolverine will have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie AND (2) The US government will end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources. AND (b) The "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie grosses more than $284.5M globally in its opening weekend according to reports AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release. The record to beat is $284.5M globally, set by the original Deadpool. BoxOfficeMojo numbers are unofficial until confirmed by Hollywood press.

(2) Resolves YES if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will Deadpool & Wolverine have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points according to 538's national polling average. Given this condition, will the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie?

Resolution criteria for Trump's lead: This is based on 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals won.

Given these conditions, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For the Clippers: Resolves Yes if they win the 2024 NBA Finals, No otherwise.
- For the USA Olympic Team: Resolves Yes if they top the medal table, No if any team equals or surpasses them.

question.body:
(1) The first part of this question involves two conditions:
   (a) The Los Angeles Clippers must be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. This resolves as No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.
   (b) The United States Olympic Team must be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals, 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals, 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

(2) The second part of this question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

It resolves NO if no new night time parade is announced between now and the end of the convention. It also resolves NO if Disney announces that an existing parade such as the Main Street Electrical Parade or Paint the Night is moving to Florida. The question closes on August 8 and resolves at the end of the convention, unless announced prior, in which case it resolves as soon as possible after the announcement.

question.title: Conditional on both of the following: (1) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" grosses >$20 million during its opening weekend and (2) Disney announces a new night parade for Magic Kingdom before D23 2024, will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) grosses more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend, as listed on BoxOfficeMojo. (2) Disney announces a new night time parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024. Given these conditions, will Chris Christie be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria for the conditions:
- "Trap" (2024) must gross more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend.
- Disney must announce a new night time parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves YES if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) grosses >$20 million during its domestic opening weekend, (2) Disney announces a new night parade for the Magic Kingdom park at or before D23 2024, and (3) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) must gross more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend. The "Domestic Opening" number is as listed on BoxOfficeMojo for "Trap" (2024), typically covering the 3-day Friday-Saturday-Sunday weekend plus previews. For example, "Old" had a domestic opening of $16,854,735, which is the equivalent number used for comparison.

(2) Disney must announce a new night time parade for the Magic Kingdom park in Walt Disney World, Florida, at or before D23 2024. The announcement must occur between now and the end of the D23 2024 convention. It will not count if Disney announces that an existing parade is moving to Florida. This question closes on August 8 or earlier if the announcement is made prior to the convention.

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Borussia Dortmund win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Borussia Dortmund wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Borussia Dortmund winning the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Borussia Dortmund wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. Then, will Joe Biden still be officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024?

question.title: Given Borussia Dortmund wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League and Joe Biden is president by end of July 2024, will "Trap" gross >$20M in opening weekend?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Borussia Dortmund wins the UEFA Champions League Final on June 1, 2024, and Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. Then, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) gross more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves **Yes** if both conditions (a) and (b) are met. (a) Borussia Dortmund wins the UEFA Champions League Final on June 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still officially president at the specified time. If either or both are not met, the question resolves **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: "Trap" (2024) must have a "Domestic Opening" number listed on BoxOfficeMojo exceeding $20 million. This number typically includes the 3-day Friday-Saturday-Sunday weekend plus previews.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Borussia Dortmund wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League, (2) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024, and (3) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" grosses over $20 million during its domestic opening weekend?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Borussia Dortmund wins the UEFA Champions League Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/), 

(b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024, and 

(c) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) grosses more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend, according to the "Domestic Opening" number listed on BoxOfficeMojo. This includes the typical 3-day Friday, Saturday, Sunday weekend plus previews, similar to how BoxOfficeMojo reported for "Old" which grossed $$16,854,735.

If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves **No**.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles, will Donald Trump be the 2024 Republican nominee?
question.body:
This question explores the potential impact of the European Union's trade policy on the US political landscape.

Condition: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources must report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.

Outcome: Resolves YES if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO if any other candidate is selected. This determination is based solely on the choice of the Republican National Convention delegates, regardless of future developments.

If the condition regarding the EU tariffs is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both the EU imposes new tariffs on Chinese EVs and Trump is the Republican nominee, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: 

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

2. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Given these conditions, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024, (2) Donald Trump be the 2024 Republican nominee, and (3) Israel carry out a deadly attack in Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

2. Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

3. Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Conditional on the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index being higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, according to the St. Louis Fed report. Then, will at least 30% of respondents in the Manifold poll agree that weak AGI was achieved before July 23, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The VXVCLS reported number for July 20, 2024, must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The Manifold poll conducted in July 2024 must show a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" respondents, for the question "has weak AGI been achieved." If this condition is met, the question resolves to YES; otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Conditional on both higher VXVCLS and weak AGI consensus, will stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 

1. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024. This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed, with the number on July 20, 2024 needing to be greater than that on July 20, 2023.

2. At least 30% of respondents in the July 2024 Manifold poll agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024. The poll results must show a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3, ignoring "no opinion" responses. The poll opens on the 23rd and closes on the 30th of July, asking if weak AGI has been achieved without defining the term.

Then, given these conditions, will the Boeing Starliner spacecraft depart the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The Starliner must undock from the ISS and begin its return journey to Earth by the specified time. Official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, or a consensus of credible reporting, will be used as the resolution source.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (2) At least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024? (3) Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The question about the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

(2) The question about weak AGI will resolve YES if the July 2024 Manifold poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th. The poll asks "has weak AGI been achieved," without defining the term, allowing respondents to vote based on their own understanding.

(3) The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Then, will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district, previously held by Bill Johnson, in the 2024 special election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's on the specified date and time.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if credible sources report a Republican victory in the special election for OH's 6th district. In case of disagreement among sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Given both Nvidia's market cap surpasses Apple's and the GOP retains Ohio's 6th district, will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024, as verified by Companies Market Cap at around 4 PM EDT. (2) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, confirmed by credible sources or Ohio State sources if needed, unless no election occurs by January 1, 2025. 

Then, will Taylor Swift appear in the movie Deadpool and Wolverine in any role, including voice roles, even if uncredited on IMDB but confirmed by independent sources?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28th, 2024, (2) the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election, and (3) Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
(1) Nvidia's market capitalization will be larger than Apple's if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (2) The Republican Party will retain Ohio's 6th congressional district if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. (3) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie 'Deadpool and Wolverine' in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

question.title: Will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Given Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will the Republicans Party of France form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then is it true that the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) will form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election? This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and the Republicans Party of France forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports, and (2) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. 

Then, will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP? This resolves to **Yes** if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this resolves to **No**. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution. The resolution can occur immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, (b) The Republicans Party of France forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, and (c) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. (2) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (3) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressuring Biden to drop out before July 20th, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports that two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out, and two of the most endangered Democrats have written off Biden's chances to win in November. Behind the scenes, drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign.

The condition resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed democrats writing to Biden will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 names are made public. Ambiguous cases will err towards NO.

The outcome resolves YES if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on both political pressure on Biden and Kenyan forces in Haiti, will ChatGPT be available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to pressure Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20, 2024, and (b) At least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti between May 22, 2024, and June 1, 2024. 

Given these conditions, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It resolves NO if this condition is not met. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and the resolution is positive if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website has changed.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, (b) At least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024, and (c) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

(b) At least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel must arrive in Haiti between May 22, 2024, and June 1, 2024, as reported by credible sources. If this occurs, the question resolves as YES.

(c) The question resolves as YES if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and NO otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Outcome criterion: Liz Cheney must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is not dependent on the eventual winner of the election, but solely on the nomination by the Republican National Convention.

question.body:
