question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The European Union announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, (2) Liz Cheney is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

2. Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

3. ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Albania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

question.title: Conditional on Albania qualifying for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%?
question.body:
This question considers two separate events: Albania's qualification for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the critical reception of M. Night Shyamalan's film "Trap" (2024).

Suppose the following is true: Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this, will "Trap" (2024) achieve a Tomatometer score of 60% or higher one week after its release on Rotten Tomatoes?

Resolution criteria: For the condition, Albania must be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Grand Final. For the outcome, "Trap" must have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% one week after release (August 9th), based on the score listed by Rotten Tomatoes.

question.title: Given Albania qualifies for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and "Trap" scores at least 60% on Rotten Tomatoes, will "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated >8.5 on IMDB?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met: (a) Albania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, which resolves as YES if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, resolving YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th).

Then, will "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (season finale) be rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release? This resolves based on the score displayed two days after release (August 6th), at noon PT, using the precision listed by IMDB (typically a single decimal), and this is a strict inequality.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Albania qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, and (c) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 is rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release?
question.body:
(a) Albania qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024: This will resolve as **Yes** if Albania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The question will resolve as **No** for all other outcomes regarding Albania.

(b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%: This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). The precision used will be whatever is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

(c) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (season finale) is rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release: This resolves based on the score displayed two days after release (August 6th), at noon PT. The precision listed by IMDB is typically a single decimal, and this is a strict inequality. The market closes 90 minutes after the episode premieres.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: If the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This means that after May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, given this situation, will Ron DeSantis be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Ron DeSantis is selected as the nominee, and No if he is not, regardless of other candidates or future additions to the list of potential nominees.

question.title: Given both an attack on the Crimean Bridge and Ron DeSantis as the Republican nominee, will the Denver Nuggets win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge, and (2) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will the Denver Nuggets be crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA? This question resolves as Yes if the Denver Nuggets win the 2024 NBA Finals, and No otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, (b) Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) The Denver Nuggets win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. (2) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (3) The Denver Nuggets are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Switzerland qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Given Switzerland qualifies for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and Russian athletes are barred from 2024 Olympics, will Poland qualify for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final of Eurovision 2024 and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, this condition is not met. (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports. For this condition to be met, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this condition is not met. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously. 

Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, and (c) Poland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Switzerland participates in a Semi-final of Eurovision 2024 and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, this condition is not met. (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will be determined based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports. For this condition to be met, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this condition is not met. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously. (c) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, this condition is not met.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on S&D holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as Yes if the S&D holds the most seats, even in case of a tie, according to official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, is it true that before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties? If such a death occurs, the question resolves as Yes; otherwise, it resolves as No.

question.title: Given both S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and an armed forces conflict death occurs between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and (b) before June 6, 2024, there is a confirmed death among the armed forces of China or Taiwan due to armed conflict between the two parties. Given these conditions, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition:
- (a) Resolves **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats, and **No** otherwise. Ties also resolve as **Yes**.
- (b) Resolves **Yes** if there is a credible report of a death due to armed conflict between China and Taiwan before June 6, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats, and **No** otherwise. Ties also resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Before June 6, 2024, there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 (c) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

(c) This question resolves as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given Google DeepMind publishes an external red-teaming safety report by June 30, 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. Then, will Asa Hutchinson be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Google DeepMind must publish a public report by June 30, 2024, detailing results from an external red-teaming of their AI model's safety.
- For the outcome: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Given both Google DeepMind publishes a red-teaming report and Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee, will at least 20 Democrats oppose the early Biden nomination plan?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (b) Asa Hutchinson is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will at least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Resolution criteria for the condition:
(a) Resolves YES if Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024.
(b) Resolves YES if Asa Hutchinson is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
Resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, (b) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) This resolves as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(c) This resolves as **YES** if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Given INC forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, will Silver close above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections (expected for May 2024). This resolves as Yes if INC forms the government after the election occurring after June 1, 2022.

Then, will the price of 1 ounce of silver be above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, according to the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com? This resolves as Yes if the price is above $30.50 USD. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below at that time, it resolves as No.

question.title: Given INC forms the government after the next Indian general election and Silver closes above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before August 3rd, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following two events occur: (a) The Indian National Congress (INC) forms the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, with a member sworn in as the next Prime Minister following the elections expected in May 2024, and (b) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 USD at exactly 4pm EST on August 9th, 2024, as determined by Kitco.com. Given these conditions, will the Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET? The market will resolve YES if she is imprisoned before this date and time, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, (b) Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024, and (c) Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday August 3rd, 2024?
question.body: (a) INC will form the government if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, expected for May 2024. (b) The price of 1 ounce of silver will be above $30.50 USD at exactly 4pm EST on August 9th, 2024, as determined by Kitco.com. The market resolves NO if the price is at or below $30.50 USD. (c) This market will resolve YES if the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Given Biden remains President through end of July 2024, will Evghenia Guțul travel to Russia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This means he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count against this condition.

Now, is it true that the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, will travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024? This question resolves as YES if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period. If the condition is not met, the resolution is N/A.

question.title: Given Biden remains President through July 2024 and Evghenia Guțul travels to Russia before June 1, 2024, will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then, and any temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not count as him ceasing to be President. (b) After April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Biden remains President through end of July 2024, (2) Evghenia Guțul travels to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024, and (3) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(1) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(2) After April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

(3) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question may consider new candidates added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in 'The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al' before June 1, 2024. 

Then, will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024)?

Resolution criteria: An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given both Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024. (b) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (2) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (3) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(1) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024. 

(2) A terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(3) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault will be broken if any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher at the 2024 Paris Olympics, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this part resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Israel qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Given Israel qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will San Marino qualify as well?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Israel participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. question.title: Conditional on both Israel and San Marino qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Israel and San Marino participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)?

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question resolves as YES if both Israel and San Marino qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final as per the EBU announcements. If either does not qualify, the condition is not satisfied.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by a letter or another form such as a group meeting with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats asking Biden to step aside do not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Both Israel and San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (2) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Both Israel and San Marino participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Israel or San Marino does not qualify, this part will resolve as **No**. (2) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Separate statements by individuals are not sufficient, and reports of unnamed democrats must have at least 5 names made public to satisfy this criteria. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

question.title: Will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market.

A 'mention' includes the following:

-A verbal usage of the word "Couch".
-Any written usage of the word "Couch" published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).

Videos posted on his social media which were filmed outside this market's time frame will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

question.title: If JD Vance says "Couch" before August, will the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
This question combines two forecasting scenarios:

1. JD Vance needs to publicly mention the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This includes any verbal or written usage of the word "Couch" on his social media or official communication channels, with certain exceptions noted in the criteria.

2. The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 must increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The exact value, not rounded, will be used for this determination based on data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

The question asks: If the first condition about JD Vance is met, will the second condition about the US Core CPI also be met?

question.title: Given both JD Vance says "Couch" before August and US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July, will at least 20 Democrats sign a letter opposing Biden's early nomination?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) JD Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25 and July 31, 2024, including any pluralization or possessive form, through verbal or written usage on official channels. (b) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. Then, will there be a public letter signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party opposing the plan to virtually nominate President Biden early, before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st? This includes multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) JD Vance say "Couch" before August (b) US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July (c) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) This will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Pluralization/possessive of the word will count. A 'mention' includes verbal usage or any written usage published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels. Videos posted outside this timeframe will not qualify.

(b) This resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL with exact values.

(c) This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on both BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024, and Elon Musk attending Bitcoin Nashville 2024, will stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k? (b) Will Elon Musk show up at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024? (c) Will stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?

(c) The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel. This will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth. The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

question.title: If the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations for COVID, influenza, and RSV occurs within four weeks of their combined peak, will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks of the combined peak for all three, according to the CDC's RESP-NET data.

Resolution criteria for this condition: The condition is met if the maximum weekly rate for each virus occurs less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined. The data must be based on the CDC's epidemiological weeks and use the rate for all ages, races, and sexes. The 2023-2024 season is defined as from the week ending October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024.

Then, is the following true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is unable to continue the race before the specified time. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Given both the peak hospitalization alignment and Biden dropping out, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is within four weeks (28 days) of the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's RESP-NET. The 2023-2024 season is from the week ending on October 7, 2023, to the week ending June 1, 2024. 

2. Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time.

Given these conditions, will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any categories indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine. The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, including categories indicating Ukrainian control or a lack of Russian control.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occur within four weeks of their combined peak, (b) Biden drop out before July 20, and (c) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

2. Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. To allow for data revisions and reporting delays, the hospitalization condition will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season are not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

3. When accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as **No** if any of the above conditions are not met. For the third condition, the question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Given Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 according to 538's national polling average. This is determined by accessing the chart on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. 

Then, will the BJP have a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections? This question resolves for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022, currently expected for May 2024. Resolves YES if the BJP forms the government, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Given both Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, and BJP forms the government in India in 2024, will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, and (b) BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections in 2024. Then, is it true that the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events? 

Resolution criteria:
- For (a), the lead is determined by 538's national polling average as accessed on July 17, 2024.
- For (b), BJP must have a member sworn in as Prime Minister following the 2024 general elections.
- For the outcome, the athlete with the highest number of gold medals must compete in swimming events for the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (b) BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024, and (c) a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections, which are expected for May 2024. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

(c) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Slovenia qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will the USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Slovenia participates in a Eurovision 2024 Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if Slovenia is announced as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It resolves as **No** if Slovenia does not qualify.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves positively if the United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It resolves negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is ordered by number of Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, then Bronze Medals.

question.title: Conditional on both Slovenia qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and the USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Slovenia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, meaning it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified; and (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, meaning the United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics, ranked by the number of Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, then Bronze Medals.

Given these conditions, will at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources? The question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, (b) USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, and (c) at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body:
(a) Slovenia qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final if it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified. If it does not qualify, this condition is not met.

(b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 if the United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The ranking is determined by the number of Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, then Bronze Medals. This condition is not met if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, this condition resolves ambiguously.

(c) This condition resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 13, will the US government end its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight on July 13, Central Time. Then, will the US Department of Commerce officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves Yes if Biden drops out before the specified date, otherwise No.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if the US government ends the agreement before August 3, 2024, otherwise No.

question.title: Given Biden drops out or is unable to continue his presidential run before July 13, 2024, and the US ends its agreement with Verisign before August 3, 2024, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. 
(b) The US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024.

Then, will the United States Olympic Team be the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- Resolves YES if the United States is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
- Resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.
- Resolves NO if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before July 13, 2024, (b) the US government ends its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, and (c) USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. This would result in a YES resolution for this part. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.
(b) The US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD), before August 3, 2024. This would result in a YES resolution for this part. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.
(c) This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.body:
Suppose the following is true:
1. For Google DeepMind, by June 30, 2024, they publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.
2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency.

Resolution for (b): This resolves as YES if Nigel Farage is elected as an MP in the specified election.

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? 

Resolution criteria for Biden's announcement: Resolves YES if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. Resolves NO if such a statement is not made by the deadline.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, (b) Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election, and (c) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

(c) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

All components must resolve as Yes for this question to resolve as Yes.

question.body:
1. Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

2. Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria: This question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as No.

3. Will "Deadpool x Wolverine" have the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie, surpassing $284.5 million globally, and be reported as such by Hollywood Reporter or an equivalent publication?

Resolution criteria: This question resolves as Yes if "Deadpool x Wolverine" grosses more than $284.5 million globally in its opening weekend according to reports, and the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) confirms it as the record for an R-rated movie release. If these conditions are not met, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Will the Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024. (According to Kitco.com trading price @ 4pm EST.)
question.body:
This market will resolve yes if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Easter standard time on August 9th 2024. The price of 1 ounce of silver will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Should the price be exactly 30.50 USD per ounce of silver at 4pm on August 9th the market will resolve as no. The question is particularly specific to the point ABOVE $30.50USD. 

Should the price be at 30.50 USD or below 30.50 USD the market will resolve as a NO. 

I will do my best to resolve this market on time, if it hasn’t been resolved by 5pm EST time on August 9th 2024, please comment and remind me to resolve the marketplace! 

Thank you

question.title: Given the Silver closes above $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, have a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On August 9, 2024, the price of 1 ounce of silver closes above $30.50 USD at exactly 4pm EST according to Kitco.com. Then, between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9, 2024, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 or below at that time, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Given silver closes above $30.50 on August 9, 2024, and a geomagnetic storm with K-index between 5 and 6 occurs, will Israel carry out a deadly attack in Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, according to the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. (2) The highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. Both conditions must be satisfied for a Yes resolution. Then, is it true that Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The price of silver closes above $30.50 on August 9th, 2024, and the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6 (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, according to the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below at that time, the condition is not met. (2) The highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. (3) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. All conditions must be satisfied for a Yes resolution.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese EVs before July 5, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The closing value of the BSE SENSEX must be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k on July 21, 2024, as per Yahoo Finance.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the EU has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given both the BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and the EU announces tariffs on Chinese EVs by July 5, 2024, will Joe Biden announce not accepting the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two events occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance. (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle? For a "Yes" resolution, Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, and official announcement to this effect, leaving no room for ambiguity or possibility of acceptance.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (2) Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? (3) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body: (1) This question resolves as **Yes** if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. (2) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. (3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" will be higher than $185,548,391, which is the combined opening of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013)? This is based on the domestic box office opening reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee and "Deadpool & Wolverine" has a higher opening, will Scotland hold an official independence referendum before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Then, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined, and (c) Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

(b) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

(c) There is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

If all (a), (b), and (c) are true, the question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden not accepting the Democratic nomination, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:

Given this, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This question resolves as Yes if more than one round is required, and No if only one round is needed.

question.title: Conditional on both Joe Biden not accepting the Democratic nomination and a brokered Democratic convention, will Croatia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true:

1. Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President. This means that prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

2. The Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, meaning the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Given these conditions, will Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? This resolves as Yes if Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it resolves as No.

(c) Will Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024? question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden dropping out, will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours before the official announcement. 

Criterion for condition: A big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post must cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This condition will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves NO otherwise.
If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: If both (a) a reliable media outlet covers Biden's dropout 6 hours in advance, and (b) an athlete wins more than one tennis medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
