(b) An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Then, will Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League? The question resolves "Yes" if Bayern Munich wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. All other teams resolve "No." If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics? (c) Will Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This part will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This part resolves YES if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(c) This part resolves YES if Bayern Munich wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. All other teams resolve "No."

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given ISS advises against Elon Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will Nvidia's market cap exceed Apple's on June 28, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting. This means that ISS releases a statement explicitly advising against one or both of these actions.

Then, is it true that on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization will be larger than Apple's? This question resolves **Yes** if, on that date, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). If not, it resolves **No**.

question.title: Conditional on ISS advising against Musk or Nvidia's market cap exceeding Apple's, will 20 Democrats oppose Biden's early nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

(a) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk.

AND

(b) Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds Apple's on June 28th, 2024.

Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk, and Nvidia's market capitalization exceeds Apple's on June 28th, 2024, and (2) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors, AND (b) on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). Otherwise, the question will resolve as **No**.

(2) This question resolves **Yes** if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

   The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. This question will resolve as **No** if any ceremony either does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online.

All three conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.body:
This question explores the scenario where the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals. It then asks whether M. Night Shyamalan's film "Trap" (2024) will achieve a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% (i.e., "Fresh") one week after its release on August 9th.

Resolution criteria for the condition (P):
- Resolves YES if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals.
- Resolves NO if any other team wins or if the Knicks are eliminated from contention.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q):
- Resolves YES if the Tomatometer score for "Trap" is 60% or higher one week after release.
- Resolves NO if the score is below 60%.

question.body:

2. "Trap" (2024) has a Tomatometer score of 60% or higher one week after release (August 9th), according to its Rotten Tomatoes page.

Given these conditions, will a red card be shown to any player or member of support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games?

A red card is shown either for serious fouls/misconduct, or as the result of a player receiving two 'warning' yellow cards. 

The market will resolve YES if any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, (2) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, and (3) There is a red card in either semi-final of UEFA Euros 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

2. "Trap" (2024) has a Tomatometer score of 60% or higher one week after release (August 9th), according to its Rotten Tomatoes page. The score is taken as whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

3. A red card is shown to any player or member of support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games. A red card is shown either for serious fouls/misconduct, or as the result of a player receiving two 'warning' yellow cards. The market will resolve YES if any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.

question.title: Conditional on USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, will the Oklahoma City Thunder win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The USD is worth at least 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to the USD/JPY close listed on Yahoo! Finance. Then, will the Oklahoma City Thunder be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA? The question resolves as Yes if the Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals, and No if they are eliminated at any stage before winning the championship.

question.title: Conditional on both USD being worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, and the Oklahoma City Thunder winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will Scotland hold an official referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) The USD/JPY exchange rate is >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, according to Yahoo! Finance, and 
(b) The Oklahoma City Thunder wins the 2024 NBA Finals as crowned by the NBA. 
Given these conditions, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024? 
The referendum must be held before May 3, 2024, and must have the consent of the UK government, not being a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum. It can be an advisory referendum.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024, (b) the Oklahoma City Thunder win the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body: (a) USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance must be >= 145 JPY. (b) The Oklahoma City Thunder must be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. (c) There must be a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the Philadelphia 76ers winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the following conditions are met:
1. The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).
2. On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

If the first condition is not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both the 76ers winning the 2024 NBA Finals and Nvidia's market cap exceeding Apple's on July 17, 2024, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following conditions are met: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals, and (b) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's.

Then, is it true that the Pandemic Agreement will be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?

Resolution criteria for the condition:
- (a) Resolves Yes if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. Resolves No if any other team wins or they are eliminated from contention.
- (b) Resolves Yes if on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Resolution criteria for the outcome:
- Resolves Yes if during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. Resolves No otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, and (c) the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** if any other team wins or they are eliminated from contention.

(b) On July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(c) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

The question resolves **No** if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Given Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, will ChatGPT be available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This can occur for any reason, and resolution should cite credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate.

Then, is it true that OpenAI's ChatGPT will be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024? "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. It still resolves positively if unavailable in certain EU countries or to specific demographics, as long as more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively even if the name or website has changed, as long as the service remains substantially the same.

question.title: Conditional on both Rishi Sunak failing to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election and ChatGPT being generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. Then, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria:
1. (a) Resolves **Yes** if Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, for any reason. Resolves **No** if he is elected.
2. (b) Resolves **Yes** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, with at least >50% of the population able to use it. Resolves **No** otherwise.

Outcome:
- Resolves **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- Resolves **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (c) Glenn Youngkin is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This part resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) This part resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(c) This part resolves as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Conditional on at least 24 world records being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolution criterion for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

Resolution criterion for the outcome: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given both 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics and diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics.
2. Before August 1, 2024, diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China, where one of the following events happens according to official statements or credible reports:
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

Given these conditions, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) At least 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024 (c) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) Before August 1, 2024, one of the following events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

(c) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

If all three of these conditions are met, the question will resolve as **Yes**. If any of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Conditional on Nvidia's market cap exceeding Apple's on June 28, 2024, will the peak US hospitalization rate for COVID, influenza, and RSV occur within four weeks of each other in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between Nvidia's market cap and US hospitalization rates for respiratory illnesses in the 2023-24 season. 

Condition: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is greater than Apple's, as verified by Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Outcome: The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the combined peak for all three, as reported by the CDC's RESP-NET.

Resolution: The hospitalization rates must be verified using CDC's epidemiological weeks, starting the week ending October 7, 2023, and ending the week ending June 1, 2024. Data will be considered final after a typical 4-week reporting delay period.

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap surpasses Apple's and peak hospitalizations align, will 538 project Biden as favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, and the peak weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US for COVID, influenza, and RSV is within four weeks of each other in the 2023-24 season. Then, will 538 project Joe Biden as the favorite over Donald Trump on July 19, 2024?

Resolution criteria for condition P: 
1. Nvidia's market cap is greater than Apple's on June 28, 2024, as per Companies Market Cap.
2. The peak hospitalization rates for COVID, influenza, and RSV occur within four weeks of each other, according to CDC's RESP-NET, for the 2023-2024 season ending June 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for outcome Q: 
- Resolves YES if Joe Biden has a higher winning probability than Donald Trump according to FiveThirtyEight's forecast for July 19, 2024.
- Resolves NO if Donald Trump has a higher probability.
- Resolves 50-50 if they have equal odds.

The resolution source for Q is FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's and will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season? (2) Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. On June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

2. The maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024. To allow for data revisions and reporting delays, the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season are not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

3. Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

   The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

   This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

   Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%? (i.e. "Fresh")
question.body:
"Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

question.title: Given M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, will Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
"Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th).

Details:

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).
For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

Resolution criteria for the outcome:

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Switzerland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Switzerland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

If "Trap" does not have a Rotten Tomatoes score of at least 60%, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) scores at least 60% on Rotten Tomatoes and Switzerland qualifies for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% one week after its release, as per Rotten Tomatoes, and (b) Switzerland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 by participating in a Semi-final and being officially announced by the EBU as qualified for the Grand Final. Given these conditions, will at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%, (b) Switzerland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (c) at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: (a) "Trap" (2024) will have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60% if its Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th), as listed by Rotten Tomatoes. (b) Switzerland will qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024 if it participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (c) At least 5 countries will win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics if, according to credible sources, 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores whether Anthropic will publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024, contingent on GUE/NGL holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections.

Condition criterion: GUE/NGL must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and if two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Outcome criterion: Anthropic must publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. Resolves **YES** if published by the deadline, and **NO** otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given both GUE/NGL holds most seats after 2024 European Elections and Anthropic publishes external red-teaming report by June 30, will Joe Biden announce dropping out and resigning before end of July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and (b) by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Then, will Joe Biden announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time? These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

If both conditions (a) and (b) are met, the question resolves YES if Joe Biden makes the required announcements before the end of July 2024, and NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) Anthropic publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024 (c) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(c) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market. Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will the Republicans Party of France form an alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) of France form a political alliance with the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the 2024 French legislative election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**. If the condition regarding the BSE SENSEX is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both BSE SENSEX closing value on July 21, 2024, being between 75k and 77k and the Republican Party of France forming an alliance with the National Rally, will the Cleveland Cavaliers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance, and (b) before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. Then, is it true that the Cleveland Cavaliers will be crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/)? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Cleveland Cavaliers win the championship, and **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (2) Will the Republican Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election? (3) Will the Cleveland Cavaliers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: (1) This part resolves as **Yes** if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. (2) This part resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (3) This part resolves as **Yes** if the Cleveland Cavaliers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). The combined question resolves as **Yes** if all three conditions are met.

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on OpenAI publishing a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024, will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

Suppose the above condition is true. Then, will Scotland hold a referendum on independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024? This question resolves as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government. If the condition regarding OpenAI is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Suppose OpenAI publishes an external red-teaming report by June 30, 2024, and Scotland holds a sanctioned independence referendum before May 3, 2024. Then, will the ICC issue arrest warrants for Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional outcome of two major events: (a) By June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models, and (b) A referendum is held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024, with the consent of the UK government.

Given these conditions, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the following Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?

- Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
- Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
- Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

Resolution criteria: The ICC must issue a warrant of arrest for any of the listed individuals by the specified date for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) OpenAI publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, (b) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and (c) the International Criminal Court issues arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) By June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) A referendum is held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. This referendum must have the consent of the UK government and not be a "wildcat" or "Catalan" style referendum. (c) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Given the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Pandemic Agreement is approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) according to reports from credible sources. Then, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?

Resolution criteria:
- **Condition**: The Pandemic Agreement must be approved at the May 2024 WHA.
- **Outcome**: Resolves **Yes** if Nigel Farage is elected as the MP for any UK constituency in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024, according to credible media reports or official announcements. Resolves **No** if this does not occur, unless the election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be annulled.

question.title: Conditional on both the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly and Nigel Farage being elected as an MP in the July 4 2024 UK General Election, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. (b) In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency, based on credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources, or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate.

Given these conditions, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)? The question resolves YES if Biden remains US President through this period; resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, (2) Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election, and (3) Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(1) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

(2) In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution should cite credible media reports from the BBC, the Times, the Financial Times, the Guardian, or other major UK news sources; or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

(3) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). The question resolves as **No** if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: If Joe Biden dies before Saturday, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden dies before Saturday. This resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Then, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This resolves as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

question.title: If both Joe Biden dies before July 26, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is >3 and <=4 on July 15, 2024, will Nvidia's market cap exceed Apple's on June 28, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true:

1. Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26, 2024. This resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.

Given these conditions, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024? This resolves YES if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Both (a) Joe Biden dies before July 26, 2024, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, and (2) Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on June 28, 2024?
question.body:
(1) (a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.
(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead.
(2) Resolves YES if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

question.title: If someone intentionally shot at Trump on July 13th, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolution criteria for P: Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

Resolution criteria for Q: This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on both a shooting at Trump on July 13, 2023, and Trump's lead over Biden being between 2 and 4 on July 15, 2024, will the American League Team win the MLB All Star Game?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Someone intentionally shoots at Trump on July 13th, 2023, and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.

Details for (a): Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th, 2023. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump. NYT reported: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Details for (b): This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

Then, is it true that the American League Team will win the MLB All Star Game? Resolves YES if the American Team wins the MLB All Star Game. I will not bet on this market.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Someone intentionally shoots at Trump on July 13th, 2023, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) The American League Team wins the MLB All Star Game?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile at Trump on July 13th, 2023. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump. 
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

(b) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden.

(c) Resolves YES if the American Team wins the MLB All Star Game. I will not bet on this market.

Edit (about 3 minutes after question creation): I changed the title from "Will the American League Team with the MLB All Star Game." It was just a typo.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris is the Democratic VP, will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body:
Suppose Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic Vice President. If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this condition is true.

The resolution criteria for the outcome are that Kimberly Cheatle must no longer be the director of the U.S. Secret Service before October 12, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

Given this, will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? This resolves as **Yes** if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing he will not accept the Democratic nomination and Trump testifying at the hush money trial, will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 15, 2024, Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial. Then, will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
1. Joe Biden must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating he will not seek or accept the Democratic nomination for President in 2024.
2. Credible sources must report that Donald Trump has testified at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- Resolves Yes if Paris Saint-Germain wins the UEFA Champions League Final on June 1, 2024. All other outcomes resolve No.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, and (2) Paris Saint-Germain wins the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (1) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. (2) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (3) Paris Saint-Germain wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to UEFA. If any of these events does not occur, this question will resolve as **No**.

Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?

question.title: Given the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed, where the reported number for July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

Then, consider the following question: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?

There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Given the VXVCLS is higher YoY on July 20, 2024, and Trump gains 3% among Manifold respondents, will Silver close above $30.50 on August 9, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: 
1. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. 
2. In Manifold polls closing on July 6, 2024, Donald Trump gains at least 3% more votes against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat.

Given these conditions, will the price of 1 ounce of silver close above $30.50 USD at exactly 4pm EST on August 9, 2024, as per Kitco.com's live ticker price?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Both above conditions must be met for it to be true.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the price of silver is above $30.50 USD at 4pm on August 9, 2024. Resolves NO if it is $30.50 USD or below.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, AND Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, (2) The price of silver closes above $30.50 at 4pm on August 9, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(1) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, as found here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. Additionally, in the Manifold polls closing on July 6, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Both conditions must be met for this part to resolve YES.

(2) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9, 2024. The price of 1 ounce of silver will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Should the price be exactly 30.50 USD per ounce of silver at 4pm on August 9th, the market will resolve as NO. The question is specific to the price being ABOVE $30.50 USD. Should the price be at 30.50 USD or below 30.50 USD, the market will resolve as NO. 

Both conditions must be met for this question to resolve YES.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris becomes President by Friday, will 'Deadpool x Wolverine' have the biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie?

Otherwise, resolves NO. If Kamala Harris is not designated as President or Acting President by the specified time, resolves N/A.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out and a reliable media outlet covers it at least 6 hours in advance, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out, and a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This condition will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

Given this scenario, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on both (a) Joe Biden dropping out with media coverage 6 hours in advance and (b) Israel expanding its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024, will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A major media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it, and (b) The Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Ted Cruz be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria:
- For condition (a), the question resolves as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.
- For condition (b), the question resolves YES if ISW reports the specified military operations.
- For the outcome, the question resolves YES if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance? (b) Will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? (c) Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The first question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers President Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The second question resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.
