question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Will Hurd is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This selection is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not relevant to who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

Then, will Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? The resolution will be based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals before the end of the Games, it resolves immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Given both (a) Will Hurd is the Republican nominee for 2024 and (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21+ golds at Paris 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be >3 and ≤4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the election day.
(b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as confirmed by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024? The polling data is as reported on the chart for that date and accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics? (c) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

(c) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Conditional on Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024. This means that credible reports indicate an attack attributed to Israel within Iran's borders leads to the death of at least five individuals during this time frame.

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination for another term as President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this question resolves as No.

question.title: Conditional on both Israel carrying out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and Joe Biden announcing before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, will Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. Given both of these conditions, will Anthropic publish a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024? The report must be published publicly and involve an external party assessing the safety of their AI models.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, (2) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (3) Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This condition resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(2) This condition resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this condition will resolve as No.

(3) This condition resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Conditional on both Vivek Ramaswamy being the Republican nominee and a journalist or opposition politician being charged in connection with the Slovak PM assassination attempt, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) a Slovak journalist or opposition politician is criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024. Given this, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- For (a), the resolution is **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.
- For (b), the resolution is **Yes** if credible Slovak media or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt, or if relevant Slovak institutions issue a statement to that effect.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
- The question resolves as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average on July 15, 2024, is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4, as reported on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (2) a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, and (3) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(2) The question will be resolved as **YES** if [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt.

Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect.

Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

(3) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

question.title: Conditional on a swimmer winning the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

Then, will Nikki Haley be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the most 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in swimming events.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves as **No** otherwise.

question.title: Given a swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics and Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events; (b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Given these conditions, will any men's pole vault athlete at the 2024 Paris Olympics clear the bar at 6.04m or higher according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources? If so, the question resolves as **Yes**. If not, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (c) The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events; (b) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election; and (c) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on the Olympic record for the men's pole vault being broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will 538 project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This question considers the condition and outcome as follows:

Condition: The Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This resolves as **Yes** if any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources.

Outcome: FiveThirtyEight projects Joe Biden as the favorite over Donald Trump on July 19, 2024. This resolves as **Yes** if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, based on the blue and red trend lines. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, it resolves according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Conditional on both the Olympic men's pole vault record being broken and FiveThirtyEight projecting Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

(a) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

Given these conditions, will Mathieu van der Poel rank higher than Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris?

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this market resolves 50%/50%.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, and (c) Mathieu van der Poel finish ahead of Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this component resolves as **No**.

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This component resolves as **Yes** if Biden is projected as the favorite and **No** if Trump is projected as the favorite. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this component resolves 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this component will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(c) Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert in the Men's Olympic Road Race in Paris. This component resolves as **Yes** if Mathieu van der Poel ranks higher than Wout van Aert. If both do not finish, the one who gives up first is ranked lower. If both give up due to the same crash or do not start, this component resolves 50%/50%. The race starts on August 3rd at 11:00 a.m. and will resolve after the race.

Therefore, the overall question resolves as **Yes** only if all (a), (b), and (c) resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD management before August 3, 2024, will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. Then, will Tim Scott be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question regarding the US government and Verisign resolves as **Yes** if the agreement is ended before August 3, 2024; otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question regarding Tim Scott resolves as **Yes** if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and **No** otherwise.

question.title: Given both the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for .com TLD and Tim Scott is the Republican nominee, will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where two specific events occur: (1) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding the management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD), and (2) Tim Scott is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Given these conditions are true, will the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election? 

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and **No** if they select a male nominee.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for managing the .com TLD before August 3, 2024, (2) Tim Scott is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (3) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). (2) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. (3) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. If any of these conditions are not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: If 538 Projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This is determined by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. Then, will the United States Olympic Team win more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Biden is projected as the favorite, NO if Trump is the favorite. If both have equal odds, resolves 50-50.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Given both Biden is favored by 538 on July 19, 2024, and the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

Resolution criteria for (a): This resolves to “Yes” if Biden is favored over Trump on July 19, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast. If Trump is favored, it resolves “No”. If odds are equal, it resolves 50-50.
Resolution criteria for (b): Resolves Yes if the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

Then, given these conditions, will Francis Suarez be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? Resolves Yes if Suarez is selected, otherwise No.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the Philadelphia 76ers winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

Suppose the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Conditional on both the Philadelphia 76ers winning the 2024 NBA Finals and Donald Trump being removed or blocked from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will Inflection publish a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. These conditions are confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Then, will Inflection publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals, (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, and (c) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

(b) This question resolves as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(c) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: If Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents. This is determined by comparing two Manifold polls closing on July 6, where one poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat on a hypothetical ballot. The condition is met if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more.

Given this condition, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024? This resolves YES if credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on both Trump gaining 3% among Manifold respondents against Biden and 50 Kenyan personnel arriving in Haiti, will Belgium qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Consider the following conditions: 
(a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat. This is determined by two polls closing on July 6, where the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the Biden poll exceeds that in the generic Democrat poll by 3% or more.
(b) At least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti between May 22, 2024, and June 1, 2024.

Given that both of the above conditions are true, will Belgium qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? This will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, it resolves as **No**. If either condition (a) or (b) is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, (b) At least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024, and (c) Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public? This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Belgium participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, travel to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

question.title: If the governor of Gagauzia, Evghenia Guțul, travels to the Russian Federation before June 1, 2024, will Biden remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the connection between two events: the potential travel of Evghenia Guțul to Russia and the continuation of Biden's presidency through July 2024.

Suppose the following is true: After April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period. Then, we ask: Will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET)?

The resolution criteria for Guțul's travel: Resolves YES if credible sources report her travel to Russian territory within the specified period. 

The resolution criteria for Biden's presidency: Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: Given that Evghenia Guțul travels to Russia between April 24 and June 1, 2024, and Biden remains US President through July 2024, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) After April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period, and (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Then, will any of the following occur before August 1, 2024, according to official statements or credible reports: 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If none of these events happen before that date, then the answer is No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Evghenia Guțul travels to the Russian Federation between April 24, 2024, and June 1, 2024, (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024, and (c) diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after April 24, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that Evghenia Guțul has traveled to Russian territory within that period.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(c) This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or [credible reports](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): 

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 

- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Conditional on Tadej Pogačar winning the Tour de France 2024, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024. This will be based on the official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

Given this condition, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given both Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024 and Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, will Meta publish a report with external red-teaming results by June 30, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following are true: (a) Tadej Pogačar is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024 based on official results from credible sources, and (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. Given these conditions, will Meta publish a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024? question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024, (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, and (c) Meta publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Tadej Pogačar must be officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France [website](https://www.letour.fr/en/) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this condition will not be met.

(c) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Given a swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics and Berkeley City Council passes the Missing Middle ordinance on July 23, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning the athlete with the highest number of gold medals competes in swimming events, and (b) The Berkeley City Council passes the Missing Middle ordinance at its July 23 meeting, meaning it resolves YES even if passed after midnight on July 24 or if watered down, resolves NO if postponed or rejected. Given these conditions, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 be less than 9.63 seconds, thus breaking the Olympic record?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics (b) The Berkeley City Council passes the Missing Middle ordinance at its July 23 meeting (c) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

(b) More information: https://darrellowens.substack.com/p/the-big-zoning-battle-of-berkeley

Must be at the July 23 meeting, resolves YES even if they pass it after midnight (on July 24), resolves YES if they water down the ordinance before passing, resolves NO if they continue the vote to a future meeting, or vote NO on the proposed ordinance.

(c) This question resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race is less than 9.63s.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. (b) At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, the men's 100m dash winning time breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

Given these conditions, will the strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, have a Planetary K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s? question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance.
(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.
(c) This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at Paris 2024 Olympics, will Joe Biden announce dropping out and resigning by July?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. This will be determined based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources, and if confirmed before the end of the Games, the condition is immediately satisfied.

Given this condition, we then consider whether Joe Biden will announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will resign from the presidency before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time. The announcement itself, made before the end of July, is sufficient for a YES resolution, even if the resignation has not formally taken place by then. If no such announcement is made by August 1st, the outcome resolves to NO.

If the condition regarding the gold medals is not met, the question resolves to N/A.

question.title: Given Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and Joe Biden announces resignation before end of July 2024, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, and Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Then, will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
1. Individual Neutral Athletes must win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as per the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources.
2. Joe Biden must announce his resignation and decision not to run for re-election before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: 
This resolves as YES if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under any flag, with no more than 34 Russians participating. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, it resolves as NO. If the Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, it resolves ambiguously.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics AND Joe Biden announces his resignation and dropping out before end of July 2024, (b) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following occur:

1. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this component will resolve immediately to "Yes".

2. Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component.

3. Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this component will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this component resolves as ambiguously.

If all three conditions are met, the combined question resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, will a terrorist attack occur in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics?

Resolution criteria for Asa Hutchinson being the nominee: Resolves Yes if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as No.

Resolution criteria for a terrorist act: Resolves Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given both Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee and a terrorist act occurs in France during the 2024 Olympics, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics. A terrorist act is defined as an attack that injures or kills at least one person (other than the terrorist(s)) between 26 July 2024 and 11 August 2024, and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Given these conditions, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 break the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds? The question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Asa Hutchinson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, and (c) the men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body:
(a) Asa Hutchinson will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A terrorist act will be considered to have occurred in Metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics if an attack injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The event must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(c) The men's 100m dash winning time will break the Olympic record of 9.63s if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

The resolution for Kamala Harris being the Democratic VP is based on whether she is nominated as the Democratic VP, regardless of any changes after the initial nomination.

question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024? 

The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

(2) Will the Cleveland Cavaliers win the 2024 NBA Finals?

The question resolves as **Yes** if the Cleveland Cavaliers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

(3) Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?

If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

Will BOTH of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden has an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024 AND the Cleveland Cavaliers win the 2024 NBA Finals, AND (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP?

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Conditional on Individual Neutral Athletes winning ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition is immediately met.

Then, will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: GIVEN Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics AND the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as reported by the official medal tally from the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. 
2. Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Given these conditions, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat? 

There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and the Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, (2) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body: This question resolves to **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as reported by the official medal tally from the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. If confirmed before the end of the Games, this condition resolves immediately to "Yes". Additionally, between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. If both these sub-conditions are met, the first condition resolves to "Yes". (2) There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This market resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. If both conditions (1) and (2) are met, this combined question resolves to "Yes"; otherwise, it resolves to "No".

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

question.title: Given Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body: The question explores the scenario where the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition in the 2024 European Parliament elections, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament. If this condition is met, will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to urge Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th? This requires a coordinated effort such as signing a letter or collectively speaking with Biden. Separate statements or unnamed reports do not meet the criteria. If the condition is not met, the question resolves NO.

question.title: Given Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality and Democratic members pressure Biden, will BSE SENSEX close between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its plurality of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament following the 2024 elections by securing more seats than any other single party or coalition. (2) At least five named Democratic Party US House Members or Senators collectively urge Joe Biden to end his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, either by signing a letter or through another form of collective action. Reports of unnamed democrats will not suffice unless at least 5 names are made public before the end date. 

Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, (2) a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and (3) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: (1) Fidesz-KDNP will maintain its plurality of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament following the 2024 elections if it secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, according to credible sources. (2) At least five named Democratic Party US House Members or Senators must collectively urge Joe Biden to end his 2024 re-election campaign before July 20th, either by signing a letter or through another form of collective action. Reports of unnamed democrats will not suffice unless at least 5 names are made public before the end date. Ambiguous cases will resolve as NO. (3) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Given at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games, will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question investigates the conditional scenario where at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The resolution is **Yes** if an athlete competing in swimming events wins the highest number of gold medals at these Olympics. The resolution for the condition is based on credible sources confirming that 5 or more countries achieve their first Olympic medal. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on at least 5 countries winning their first Olympic medal and a swimmer winning the most golds at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources, and (b) the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

Suppose the above conditions are true. Then, will the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than $185,548,391, which is the combined opening for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013)? This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo is higher than $185,548,391.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal and a swimmer wins the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics, AND (2) The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur:

1. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events, according to credible sources.

2. The domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box office openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013), as reported by Boxofficemojo.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Conditional on Biden remaining President through the end of July 2024, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden remains the President of the United States through the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time), meaning he does not resign, die, or otherwise cease to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect this condition.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump Jr. will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected as the nominee, and NO if any other candidate is selected. The resolution of this question is determined solely by the selection at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given Biden remains President through July 2024 and Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution. (b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolution is not affected by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election; it depends solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention delegates.

Then, will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election? This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (c) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution. (b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This resolution is not affected by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election; it depends solely on the selection by the Republican National Convention delegates. (c) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. This resolves as YES if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in this election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this resolves as NO. Resolution should cite credible media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).
