question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

question.title: If Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al* before June 1, 2024. Then, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in the mentioned case, with indictments occurring before June 1, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Given both Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, and Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true: (a) Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*, with indictments occurring before June 1, 2024, and (b) credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

Then, will the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, it resolves as Yes if the same NOC has won at least two of these events.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024, (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and (c) the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
(a) The question about Donald Trump resolves **Yes** if he is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

(b) The question about Israel resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(c) The question about the Olympics resolves **Yes** if the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It resolves **No** if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in these eight team sports.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Conditional on the US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July, will Joe Biden have a 45+ minute in-person interview on camera before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using exact values from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024? 

The interview must be in-person and on camera, lasting at least 45 minutes of new footage. It does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., but can include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, provided the criteria are met. If no such interview is released by the end of July, the answer is NO.

question.title: Conditional on both a US Core CPI increase over 0.1% and a 45+ minute Joe Biden interview by July 2024, will stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met by the end of July 2024: (a) The seasonally adjusted US Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, with data sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL using the exact (not rounded) value. (b) Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late night shows, or interviews edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this condition is not met.

Given these conditions, will the Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, depart the International Space Station (ISS) by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024? For resolution, the Starliner must undock from the ISS and begin its return journey to Earth. The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however, a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by the specified dates: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024, (b) Joe Biden has an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes by the end of July 2024, and (c) The Boeing Starliner departs the ISS with astronauts by July 21, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if Joe Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late night shows, or interviews edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there are at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., do not count. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO.

(c) Resolves YES if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth. The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: If Linda Yaccarino is CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, and Francis Suarez is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Nigel Farage be elected as an MP in the July 4, 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:

The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes** -- this question resolves on the basis of his election or non-election.

question.title: Conditional on Google DeepMind publishing a report with results from external red-teaming by June 30, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
For Google DeepMind, the condition resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

For the ID political group, the outcome resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It resolves as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Given both Google DeepMind publishes a safety red-teaming report and ID holds the most seats, will Cyprus qualify for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) By June 30, 2024, Google DeepMind publishes a public report with results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models, and (2) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections.   - ID political group part resolves as YES if they hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, with ties also resolving as YES.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Cyprus is announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final after participating in a Semi-final. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, (2) the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, and (3) Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
(1) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(2) For the ID political group, this resolves as **Yes** if they hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**. This is based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(3) For Cyprus, this resolves as **Yes** if Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

question.title: Given that at least 24 world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis?

Suppose the following is true: At least 24 world records are broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics. Then, is it true that an athlete will win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

question.title: Given at least 24 world records are broken and an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will Blake Lively's "It Ends With Us" outgross Ryan Reynold's "Deadpool & Wolverine" this weekend?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Paris Olympics, at least 24 world records are broken and an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis. Then, will Blake Lively's "It Ends With Us" have a higher domestic gross than Ryan Reynold's "Deadpool & Wolverine" for the weekend of August 9-11?

Resolution criteria:

- For the condition: The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics must be 24 or greater, and any athlete must win at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

- For the outcome: The question resolves as YES if "It Ends With Us" has a higher domestic gross than "Deadpool & Wolverine" for the weekend of August 9-11, as reported by BoxOfficeMojo under the "weekend" tab for that date range.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At least 24 world records are broken and an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (2) Blake Lively's "It Ends With Us" outgrosses Ryan Reynold's "Deadpool & Wolverine" this weekend.
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following occur: (1) Both of the following occur during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater. (b) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis. (2) "It Ends with Us" has a higher (domestic) gross than "Deadpool & Wolverine" for the weekend of August 9-11, according to BoxOfficeMojo's "weekend" tab for that date.

question.title: Given both of the following occur: (a) Either Tadej Pogacar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024, and (b) Inflection publishes a safety report by June 30, 2024, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Either Tadej Pogacar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024, and (b) Inflection publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024. Then, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as YES if both conditions (a) and (b) are met. 

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Either Tadej Pogacar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024, (2) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024, and (3) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Either Tadej Pogacar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024, (2) Inflection publishes a public report with the results from an external party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models by June 30, 2024, and (3) credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Estonia qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Slovenia also qualify?
question.body: Suppose Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Given this scenario, will Slovenia also participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? The question resolves as **Yes** if Slovenia qualifies under these conditions, and **No** if it does not qualify.

question.title: Given both Estonia and Slovenia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Estonia and Slovenia participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if both Estonia and Slovenia qualify for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either or both do not qualify, the condition is not met, and the question resolves as **N/A**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if the winning height of the men's pole vault at the 2024 Paris Olympics is 6.04m or higher. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) both Estonia and Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, and (b) the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Both Estonia and Slovenia participate in their respective Semi-finals and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (2) The winning height of the men's pole vault at the 2024 Paris Olympics is 6.04m or higher. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Given Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question examines the correlation between Nvidia's market cap surpassing Apple's on July 17, 2024, and the BJP forming the government after the next Indian general election in 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if, on July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The outcome resolves as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

(b) Will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024? (c) Will Meta publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**. This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

(c) This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Meta publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

(2) Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given that ISS advises against Musk's package or Kimbal Musk's re-election, will 5 countries win their debut gold at 2024 Olympics?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Then, will at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics according to credible sources?

question.title: Conditional on BOTH ISS advising against Tesla's shareholder proposals OR Kimbal Musk's re-election AND 5 countries winning debut golds at the 2024 Olympics, will UCLA hold its in-person graduation ceremonies on June 14, 2024?
question.body:
The question considers two conditions: 1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advises Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package or the re-election of Kimbal Musk at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting. 2) Five or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Resolution criteria for P: The combined question will resolve as **Yes** if both conditions are met. If either condition is not met, it resolves as **No**.

Suppose both of these are true. Then, the question is whether UCLA will hold all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 on June 14, 2024, at the Pauley Pavilion, starting within 1 hour of the scheduled times of 11 AM, 3 PM, and 7 PM.

Resolution criteria for Q: Resolves **Yes** if all ceremonies occur as scheduled and within the specified time frame. Resolves **No** if any ceremony does not meet these criteria.

question.title: Will BOTH of the following occur: (1) EITHER of the following occurs: (a) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package OR (b) ISS advises against the re-election of Kimbal Musk AND (2) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics AND (3) UCLA hold its in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies scheduled for June 14, 2024?
question.body: The combined question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: 1) Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement advising Tesla shareholders to vote against either Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. 2) Five or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, according to credible sources. 3) The University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 scheduled for June 14, 2024, at the Pauley Pavilion at the specified times. The ceremonies must all occur at the specified locations and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. If all conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump, Biden or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if during the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins. They will be the sole deciders of whether this has happened or not, and their decision will be final. In cases of ambiguity they may consult CNN's official transcript, typically posted at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/). It's important to note, however, that in the absence of a clear utterance of the word, especially if it does not appear in the transcript, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on "deepfake" being said in the CNN debate, will the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, either Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." This determination is at the discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript.

Given this, will the Indiana Pacers be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA? The question resolves as **Yes** if the Pacers win the Finals, and **No** otherwise.

question.title: Given both Trump, Biden, or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate on June 27, 2024, and the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals, will Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN on June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake," as determined by Metaculus's Admins possibly consulting CNN's official transcript, and (b) the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals according to the NBA. 

Given these conditions, will Joe Biden announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President in the 2024 election cycle? The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump, Biden, or a moderator say "deepfake" in the CNN debate in Atlanta on June 27, 2024, (b) the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals, and (c) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) During the broadcast of the presidential debate held by CNN scheduled for June 27, 2024, Donald Trump, Joe Biden, or one of the moderators utters the word "deepfake." Determination of whether one of the candidates or moderators has uttered "deepfake" will be at the sole discretion of Metaculus's Admins, who may consult CNN's official transcript at [transcripts.cnn.com](https://transcripts.cnn.com/).

(b) The Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

(c) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

The question resolves as **No** if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: If the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will the men's 100m dash at the Paris 2024 Olympics break the record?

Then, will the men's 100m dash winning time at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics break the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds? This question resolves as Yes if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. question.title: Given both the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, and the men's 100m dash Olympic record is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two events occur:

1. Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

2. At the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics, any athlete runs the Men's 100m race in less than 9.63 seconds, breaking the Olympic record, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

Given these conditions, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, (b) the men's 100m dash Olympic record is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (c) the Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

(b) At the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics, any athlete runs the Men's 100m race in less than 9.63 seconds, breaking the Olympic record, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

(c) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

This means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and that it is available to more than 50% of the population. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and this still holds if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service remains substantially the same.

Then, is it true that M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) will gross more than $20 million during its domestic opening weekend? The "Domestic Opening" number is as listed on BoxOfficeMojo for "Trap" (2024), typically defined as the 3-day FSS weekend plus previews.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Given a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, and Tadej Pogačar wins the Tour de France 2024, will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

Resolution criteria:
- For (1): At least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators must collectively ask Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024.
- For (2): Tadej Pogačar must be recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024.
- For the outcome: Larry Elder must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, (2) Tadej Pogačar win the Tour de France 2024, and (3) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this condition resolves NO.

(2) Tadej Pogačar must be officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

(3) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

All three conditions must be satisfied for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: If Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Nigel Farage be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not relevant to who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

Then, is it true that Nigel Farage will be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if Nigel Farage is elected as the MP for any UK constituency on that date, and **No** if he is not, unless the election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be annulled. Resolution is based on credible reports from major UK news sources or official announcements from returning officers.

question.title: Given Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for 2024 and Nigel Farage is elected MP in July 2024, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:

1. Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**.

Resolution for the second condition should cite credible media reports from major UK news sources or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

Then, is it true that at least 5 countries will win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the 2024 Paris Olympics, according to credible sources?

question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

2. In the 2024 UK general election held on July 4, 2024, Nigel Farage is elected as the member of parliament (MP) for any UK constituency. The question will resolve as **No** if this does not occur, unless the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be **annulled**. Resolution for the second condition should cite credible media reports from major UK news sources or the official announcement of the returning officer for any constituency in which Nigel Farage is a candidate. Farage need not be sworn in as an MP for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

3. At least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Conditional on the Pandemic Agreement being approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, (2) Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdom at D23 2024, and (3) S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources. (2) Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden announcing his resignation and dropping out before end of July, will Nigel Farage be elected MP in July 4 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Then, is it true that Nigel Farage will be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024, UK General Election?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes the announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Otherwise, resolves NO on August 1st.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Nigel Farage is elected as MP for any UK constituency in the July 4, 2024, UK general election. Resolves NO if this does not occur, unless the election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, in which case the question will be annulled.

question.title: If both Joe Biden announces his resignation and Nigel Farage is elected as an MP, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024 that he is no longer running for re-election and intends to resign from the presidency without completing his current term, and (2) Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election held on July 4, 2024. Resolution criteria: The condition is met if both Joe Biden makes the announcement and Nigel Farage is elected as an MP. The outcome resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces his intention to drop out and resign before the end of July 2024, (b) Nigel Farage is elected as an MP in the July 4 2024 UK General Election, and (c) the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Joe Biden announces before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time, that he is no longer running for re-election and that he intends to resign from the presidency without completing his current term. This announcement is sufficient, and he does not need to have formally resigned by the end of July. (2) Nigel Farage is elected as a Member of Parliament for any UK constituency in the general election held on July 4, 2024. The election result should be confirmed by credible media reports or official announcements from the returning officer. If the general election is cancelled or postponed beyond July 4, 2024, this part of the question will be annulled. (3) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves NO if any of the conditions are not met.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Conditional on the BSE SENSEX closing between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will Joe Biden have an in-person interview or conversation on camera that lasts for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The closing value of the BSE SENSEX must be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera lasting at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. The interview must include at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Resolves NO if no such interview occurs by the end of July 2024.

question.title: Given both BSE SENSEX conditions and Biden's interview occur, will USD be worth >= 145 JPY at close on August 9th, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true:

1. The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

2. Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This interview must be released by market close at the end of July. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts or late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, and similar events do not qualify. For context, previous interviews such as Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April (70 minutes) qualify, whereas his interviews with Stephanopoulos in July and Jimmy Fallon in February (less than 30 minutes each) do not qualify.

Then, will the USD be worth greater than or equal to 145 JPY at the close on August 9th, 2024, according to the USD/JPY close listed for August 9th, 2024 on Yahoo! Finance?

question.body:
This question resolves positively if all of the following conditions are met:

1. The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

2. Joe Biden participates in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This interview must be released by market close at the end of July. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts or late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, and similar events do not qualify. For context, previous interviews such as Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April (70 minutes) qualify, whereas his interviews with Stephanopoulos in July and Jimmy Fallon in February (less than 30 minutes each) do not qualify.

3. The USD/JPY closing value on August 9th, 2024, is greater than or equal to 145, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Conditional on USA topping the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The United States Olympic Team are the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics based on the number of Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals. Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance? If the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027, the question resolves ambiguously. If any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team, the condition is not met, and the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Given the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024 and BSE SENSEX closes between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Disney announce a new Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The United States tops the Olympic Medal Table at the 2024 Paris Olympics, meaning they are the unique highest ranked team based on the number of gold, silver, and bronze medals won, and (b) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000 according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will Disney announce that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024?

To resolve YES, Disney must announce a new ride that includes aerial views above Tomorrowland and meets at least two of the following criteria: (1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name, (2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure, (3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment, (4) has a station in the old Peoplemover station building, or (5) rebuilds the station with similar characteristics and location. The announcement must occur at D23 2024, specifically in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) USA will top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, (2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX will be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k, and (3) Disney will announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
(1) USA will top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024: This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team. The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals.

(2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX will be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

(3) Disney will announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024: This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Given Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election, will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This means that for any reason, he does not secure a seat as an MP in this election, as confirmed by credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer.

Then, considering this scenario, will Biden drop out or otherwise be unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, Central Time? If Biden drops out or is unable to continue before this deadline, the answer is YES; otherwise, it is NO.

question.title: GIVEN both (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election AND (b) Biden drops out before July 13, will diplomatic expulsions or recalls occur between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
(a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This means that for any reason, if Sunak is not elected as an MP in this election, it is considered true. Credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate will confirm this.
(b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024 Central Time. This will be confirmed by credible reports or official statements.

Then, given these conditions, will any of the following events occur before August 1, 2024, as per official statements or credible reports?
- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If any of these events occur, the question resolves as Yes. If none of these events are reported before that date, the question resolves as No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election (b) Biden drops out before 7/13 (c) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4, 2024 UK general election. This means that for any reason, if Sunak is not elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in this election, this condition is satisfied. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

(b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024 Central Time. If Biden does not drop out by this time, this condition is not satisfied.

(c) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024. This condition resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of the following events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) are met, this question resolves as Yes. If any one of these conditions is not met, this question resolves as No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) closes below $100 per share on any day before 7/31, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (c) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
