question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

question.title: Conditional on a geomagnetic storm with K-index between 4 and 6 occurring, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, the strongest geomagnetic storm has a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product. Then, will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) must be greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

question.title: Given both a moderate geomagnetic storm and ChatGPT availability in the EU, will Iran carry out a deadly attack in Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. 

Resolution criteria for condition: 
(a) Resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences.
(b) Resolves Yes if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is access without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it.

Then, is the following statement true: Will Iran carry out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?

Resolution criteria for outcome: Resolves Yes if credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders leads to the death of at least five individuals before May 1, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The strongest geomagnetic storm between July 17 and July 28, 2024, has a K-index greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (c) Iran carries out a deadly attack within Israel before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(c) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Iran and occurring within Israel's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two seemingly unrelated events: the political polling data and the outcome of the NBA Finals.

Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will the Miami Heat be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA? This resolves YES if the Miami Heat wins the championship, and NO if any other team wins or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on Trump's lead over Biden being greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, and the Miami Heat winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: 
1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value indicates a Trump lead.
2. The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA.
3. Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final.

If either of the first two conditions is not met, the question resolves N/A. If the third condition is not met, the question resolves No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, (2) the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals, and (3) Portugal qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. (2) The Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. (3) Portugal participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. It resolves **No** if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being removed or blocked from any U.S. state primary election ballot for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

Given that condition, will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly? This resolves as Yes if, during the May 2024 WHA, the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

question.title: Given both Donald Trump is removed from a ballot under the 14th Amendment and the Pandemic Agreement is approved, will the French Prime Minister belong to a different coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true: 
1. Donald Trump is officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. 
2. The Pandemic Agreement is approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

Given these conditions, will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024? This resolves as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, (b) the Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly, and (c) the Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as of July 15, 2024. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note that the resolution does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. The Pandemic Agreement is approved during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

3. The party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

The question will resolve as "No" if any of these conditions are not met.

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race is less than 9.63s.

question.title: Given the men's 100m dash at the Paris 2024 Olympics breaks the Olympic record, will "House of the Dragon" S2E7 have an IMDB rating >8.5?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, the men's 100m dash winning time is less than 9.63 seconds, breaking the Olympic record. Then, will the IMDB rating for "House of the Dragon" Season 2 Episode 7 (title TBA) be greater than 8.5, two days after its release?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The men's 100m race winning time must be less than 9.63 seconds.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The IMDB rating for "House of the Dragon" S2E7 must be strictly greater than 8.5, based on the score displayed two days after release (July 30th), at noon PT. The precision used will be as listed by IMDB, typically a single decimal.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both the Olympic 100m record being broken and "House of the Dragon" S2E7 being rated >8.5, will Taylor Swift cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The winning time of the men's 100m race at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 is less than 9.63 seconds, breaking the Olympic record, and (b) "House of the Dragon" Season 2, Episode 7 receives a rating greater than 8.5 on IMDB, checked on July 30th at noon PT. 

Resolution criteria for these conditions: 
- (a) Resolves YES if the 100m dash winning time is less than 9.63 seconds.
- (b) Resolves YES if the IMDB rating is greater than 8.5 with the precision listed by IMDB.

Given these conditions, will Taylor Swift appear in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if uncredited on IMDB but confirmed by independent sources? Resolves YES if she appears in any capacity, including voice roles.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The men's 100m dash winning time at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 breaks the Olympic record of 9.63s, (b) "House of the Dragon" S2E7 is rated >8.5 on IMDB, 2 days after release, and (c) Taylor Swift cameos in Deadpool and Wolverine?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as Yes if the winning time of the men's 100m race at the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024 is less than 9.63s.

(b) This question resolves as Yes if "House of the Dragon" S2E7 is rated greater than 8.5 on IMDB two days after its release. The rating will be checked on July 30th, at noon PT, using the precision listed by IMDB (typically a single decimal). This is a strict inequality. The market closes 90 minutes after the episode premieres.

(c) Resolves YES if Taylor Swift appears in the movie "Deadpool and Wolverine" in any role, even if it is just her voice used for a character. Will still resolve YES if she is not credited on IMDB, if it is still confirmed by independent sources.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Greece qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Greece qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024. This means that Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

Then, is the following statement true? The United States wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. This resolves as Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. It resolves as No if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

question.title: Given Greece qualifies for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and USA wins gold in Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball, will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP nominee?
question.body: This question explores the relationship between two seemingly unrelated events. Suppose the following conditions are true: (1) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (2) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics. Given these conditions, will Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP? This resolves to YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP and NO if someone else is selected. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and not affected by any subsequent changes.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Greece qualifies for Eurovision 2024 Grand Final and USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's basketball at Paris Olympics (b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (2) Team USA wins gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, and (3) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If any of these conditions are not met, the question will resolve as **No**. Note that if Kamala Harris is initially nominated as VP, subsequent changes do not affect this resolution.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will Nvidia's market cap exceed Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
The condition for this question is that Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. It can include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, as long as there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

The outcome of interest is whether Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024. This will be determined based on the market cap values listed on Companies Market Cap, checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that date.

If the condition is met, does the outcome occur?

question.title: Given Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024 AND Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will the Berkeley City Council pass the Missing Middle ordinance at its July 23 meeting?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and on July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's.

The criteria for these conditions are: 
- Joe Biden must participate in an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.
- On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization must be greater than Apple's, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

Then, given these conditions, will the Berkeley City Council pass the Missing Middle ordinance at its July 23 meeting? The ordinance must be passed at the July 23 meeting, resolving YES even if passed after midnight (on July 24). It resolves YES if they water down the ordinance before passing, and resolves NO if they continue the vote to a future meeting, or vote NO on the proposed ordinance.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024 AND Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, AND (2) the Berkeley City Council passes the Missing Middle ordinance at its July 23 meeting?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024, AND will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
(a) Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024? 
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count. For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

(b) On July 17, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's? 
This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

This question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as described.

(2) Will the Berkeley City Council pass the Missing Middle ordinance at its July 23 meeting?
More information: https://darrellowens.substack.com/p/the-big-zoning-battle-of-berkeley

Must be at the July 23 meeting, resolves YES even if they pass it after midnight (on July 24), resolves YES if they water down the ordinance before passing, resolves NO if they continue the vote to a future meeting, or vote NO on the proposed ordinance.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

question.title: Conditional on Trump gaining at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden, will someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard win the Tour de France 2024?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat. This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources.

If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both Trump gaining support and an unexpected Tour de France winner, will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (b) someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024.

(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) This question resolves based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources. The answer is YES if someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard is recognized as the winner.

Then, is it true that a terrorist act will occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?

The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, (b) someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard wins the Tour de France 2024, and (c) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This question resolves YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(b) This question resolves based on the cyclist who is officially recognized as the winner of the Tour de France 2024, based on official results published on the Tour de France website or other credible sources. The answer is YES if someone other than Tadej Pogačar or Jonas Vingegaard is recognized as the winner.

(c) The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given the Republicans Party of France forms an alliance with the National Rally, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 77k on July 21, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. Then, on July 21, 2024, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000? The closing value is determined according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Given a political alliance between Les Républicains and National Rally and BSE SENSEX between 75k and 77k, will 50 Kenyan personnel arrive in Haiti by June 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. (2) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti. If either the political alliance or the BSE SENSEX condition is not met, this question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k (3) At least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel arrive in Haiti before June 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this part resolves as **No**. (2) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. If this condition is not met, this part resolves as **No**. (3) After May 22, 2024, and before June 1, 2024, credible sources report that at least 50 Kenyan military or police personnel have arrived in Haiti. If this condition is not met, this part resolves as **No**. If all three conditions are met, the question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Conditional on Joe Biden having an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. The interview must be released before market close at the end of July and must not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes, but there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. 

Then, will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics? This resolves as **Yes** if any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Given Joe Biden has a 45+ minute in-person interview and the Olympic men's pole vault record is broken, will he announce dropping out and resigning by July 2024?
question.body:
This question considers two conditions: 
1. Joe Biden must have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., and includes appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 Minutes with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.
2. At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete must clear the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources.

Given these two conditions are met, the question is whether Joe Biden will announce both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. The announcement of his intention is sufficient, and he does not have to formally resign by the end of July. If these conditions are not met, this question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview on camera for 45+ minutes and the Olympic record for the men's pole vault is broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics, and (2) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, excluding press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc., and including appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 Minutes with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. (2) At the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the International Olympic Committee or credible sources. (3) Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient. If any of these do not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Given that the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, will Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥21 gold medals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics. This means that at least one National Olympic Committee (NOC) has won gold in at least two of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Then, is it true that Individual Neutral Athletes will win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games? This will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals according to the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources. Otherwise, it will resolve to "No".

question.title: Given both a single nation wins multiple women's team sports and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21+ golds at 2024 Olympics, will Kamala Harris pick Kelly or Shapiro as VP?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: At the 2024 Olympics, (1) a single National Olympic Committee wins gold in more than one women's team sport, and (2) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals based on the official medal tally by the International Olympic Committee (IOC).

Then is it true that Kamala Harris will choose either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate for Vice President before August 7th?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P):
- The same NOC must win gold in more than one women's team sport.
- Individual Neutral Athletes must win 21 or more gold medals.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q):
- Resolves YES if Kamala Harris announces Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro as her running mate.
- Resolves NO if she announces anyone else.
- The announcement must be confirmed by Kamala herself.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) At the 2024 Olympics, the same nation wins more than one women's team sport and Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals, and (2) Kamala Harris' VP Pick is either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro?
question.body:
This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met:

1. At the 2024 Olympics:
   - The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one women's team sport. This means that not all eight team sports (association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo) are won by teams from different NOCs.
   - Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals. The resolution will be based on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if IOC reporting is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals before the end of the Games, the market resolves immediately to Yes.

2. Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th. This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. The resolution will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Conditional on the USA winning more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question explores the scenario where the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Given this condition, the question asks whether at least 5 countries will win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

question.title: Given both the USA wins more Gold than Silver medals and at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, and (b) Five or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics. Then, will the European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if both (a) and (b) are true. 
Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal (b) ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics and five or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources. (b) The European Conservatives and Reformists (ECR) hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes.

question.title: Will a journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024?
question.body:
The question will be resolved as **YES** if [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt.

Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect.

Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

question.title: Given a journalist or opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, will "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A Slovak journalist or opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024. This will be considered true if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report such charges, or if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect.

Then, will the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than the combined domestic box office openings of "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013)? This resolves as Yes if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo is higher than $185,548,391 (the sum of $132,434,639 for "Deadpool" and $53,113,752 for "The Wolverine").

question.title: Given both an assassination charge in Slovakia and a high box office for "Deadpool & Wolverine", will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) A Slovak journalist or opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, and (b) The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391. Then, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
(a) Resolves YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, or if relevant Slovak institutions issue a statement to that effect. Otherwise, resolves NO.
(b) Resolves YES if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391. Otherwise, resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and NO for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as YES. Based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A Slovak journalist or opposition politician is charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024, (b) The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is higher than $185,548,391, and (c) GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will be resolved as **YES** if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024. Alternatively, the resolution will also be **YES** if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect. Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

(b) This part of the question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for "Deadpool" (2016) and "The Wolverine" (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. Otherwise, the question will be resolved as **NO**.

(c) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

question.title: Given Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris. This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.

Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

question.title: Given Kalenjin athletes win both marathons and the same nation wins multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics, will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 
1. The winners of both the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots.
2. The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins at least two of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Given these conditions, will Tim Scott be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? The resolution of this question is based on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual nominee on the election day.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics and the same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics, and (2) Tim Scott will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The winners of both the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, and the same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins at least two of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. (2) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If either condition is not met, the question resolves as **No**.

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Given BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, will stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. Then, will the Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, depart the International Space Station (ISS) with these astronauts by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024?

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth. The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Given both the BSE SENSEX closes between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, and Boeing Starliner departs with astronauts by July 21, will at least 5 countries win debut golds at 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are met: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX is greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, as reported by Yahoo Finance. (b) By 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024, the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, as confirmed by official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing or a consensus of credible reporting.

Given these conditions, will at least 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, according to credible sources?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k? (b) Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21? (c) At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

(b) This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth. The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

(c) This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Given a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France, injuring and/or killing at least one person other than the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The attack is described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the opposition leader Maria Corina Machado be imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 at 00:00 VET?

question.title: Given both a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before August 3, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true:

(a) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(b) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3, 2024, at 00:00 VET.

Given these conditions, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? This resolves as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats, and No for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as Yes. Official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports are the basis for resolution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics AND Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday, August 3rd, 2024 (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question will resolve as Yes if both of the following occur: (1) A terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. AND (2) The opposition leader Maria Corina Machado is imprisoned before Friday August, 3rd of 2024 at 00:00 VET.

(b) The question will resolve as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Cristiano Ronaldo score a goal during Euro 2024?
question.body:
He has yet to score a goal during the European Cup. Will he end up goalless or will he score?

Will resolve YES if he scores according to https://www.uefa.com/euro2024/statistics/players/goals/ *

Will resolve NO if he doesn't. 

*Penalties scored during penalty shoot-outs are not counted towards goals scored by individual players in their goal records. Own goals also do not count.
