question.title: Given Cristiano Ronaldo scores a goal during Euro 2024, will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body:
Cristiano Ronaldo has yet to score a goal during the European Cup. Will he end up goalless or will he score? 

Resolution criteria for Ronaldo scoring: Resolves YES if he scores according to https://www.uefa.com/euro2024/statistics/players/goals/. Penalties scored during penalty shoot-outs and own goals do not count.

Resolution criteria for Biden dropping out: Resolves YES if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Resolves NO otherwise.

Suppose the following is true: Cristiano Ronaldo scores a goal during Euro 2024. Then, will Biden drop out or be unable to continue his run as president before July 13?

question.title: Conditional on both Cristiano Ronaldo scoring during Euro 2024 and Biden dropping out before July 13, 2024, will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Cristiano Ronaldo scores a goal during Euro 2024, according to UEFA's official statistics, excluding penalty shoot-out goals and own goals, and (b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his presidential run before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time.

Given these conditions, will Larry Elder be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. All other candidates will resolve as No. The resolution is based solely on the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Cristiano Ronaldo scores a goal during Euro 2024, (b) Biden drops out before July 13, 2024, and (c) Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Cristiano Ronaldo score a goal during Euro 2024? He has yet to score a goal during the European Cup. Will he end up goalless or will he score?

This will resolve YES if he scores according to https://www.uefa.com/euro2024/statistics/players/goals/ 

This will resolve NO if he doesn't. 

*Penalties scored during penalty shoot-outs are not counted towards goals scored by individual players in their goal records. Own goals also do not count. 

(b) Will Biden drop out before 7/13? If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

(c) Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

question.title: Given Russian athletes are barred from the 2024 Olympics, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics. This means that Russian athletes are not competing under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russians competing.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined by the value reported on 538's chart for July 15, 2024, accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead.

question.title: Given Russian athletes are barred from the 2024 Olympics and Trump's lead over Biden is within a specific range, will the Oklahoma City Thunder win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, meaning they are not allowed to compete under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russian athletes participating. This will be resolved based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without significant Russian participation. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this condition is not met. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this part resolves as ambiguously.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a reported value of Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden means a positive value of 2.4 for this purpose.

Then, is it true that the Oklahoma City Thunder will win the 2024 NBA Finals? This resolves as **Yes** if the Oklahoma City Thunder is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to the NBA. It resolves as **No** for all other outcomes as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics, (b) Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) the Oklahoma City Thunder win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
(a) Russian athletes will be considered barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics if they are not allowed to compete under the Russian flag, the Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or any other independent or neutral flag, with no more than 34 Russian athletes participating. This will be resolved based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the 2024 Olympics or credible media reports indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without significant Russian participation. If more than 34 Russian athletes compete, this condition is not met. If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this part resolves as ambiguously.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. For example, a reported value of Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden means a positive value of 2.4 for this purpose.

(c) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Oklahoma City Thunder is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other outcomes as they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Will the Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024. (According to Kitco.com trading price @ 4pm EST.)
question.body:
This market will resolve yes if the price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Easter standard time on August 9th 2024. The price of 1 ounce of silver will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Should the price be exactly 30.50 USD per ounce of silver at 4pm on August 9th the market will resolve as no. The question is particularly specific to the point ABOVE $30.50USD. 

Should the price be at 30.50 USD or below 30.50 USD the market will resolve as a NO. 

I will do my best to resolve this market on time, if it hasn’t been resolved by 5pm EST time on August 9th 2024, please comment and remind me to resolve the marketplace! 

Thank you

question.title: If silver closes above $30.50 on August 9, 2024, will Disney announce a new Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: On August 9, 2024, the price of 1 ounce of silver closes above $30.50 USD at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time, as determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. Then, on August 10, 2024, at the Disney Experiences Showcase during D23, will Disney announce that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover for Disneyland?

For the Peoplemover announcement to resolve as YES, the new attraction must:
- Include views above Tomorrowland.
- Have at least two of the following characteristics:
  1) Include "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name.
  2) Use existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride.
  3) Rebuild portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride.
  4) Have a station in the old Peoplemover station building.
  5) Rebuild the old Peoplemover station with similar characteristics and location.

The announcement will resolve to YES if the new ride uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles ride, but will resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover is announced that takes place entirely inside of a show building with no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

If the silver price is exactly $30.50 or below at 4pm on August 9, 2024, the condition is not met, and the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both Silver closes above $30.50 on August 9, 2024, and Disney announces a new Peoplemover at D23 2024, will a journalist or opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following occur: (a) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024, as determined by Kitco.com, and (b) Disney announces a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024, meeting specific criteria related to the Peoplemover ride.

Then, is it true that a journalist or an opposition politician will be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico, before June 15, 2024? This resolves YES if credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report such charges, or if relevant Slovak institutions issue a statement to that effect. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The Silver Close above $30.50 @4pm on August 9th, 2024, according to Kitco.com, (2) Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024, and (3) A journalist or an opposition politician be charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(1) The price of 1 ounce of silver is above $30.50 (USD) at exactly 4pm Eastern Standard Time on August 9th, 2024. The price will be determined by the live ticker price per ounce listed on Kitco.com. If the price is exactly $30.50 USD or below at that time, this part resolves as NO.

(2) Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024. The new version must be a ride with views above Tomorrowland and have at least two of the following characteristics: (a) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name, (b) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride, (c) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment, (d) has a station in the old Peoplemover station building, (e) rebuilds the old Peoplemover station with similar characteristics and location. A new ride using Peoplemover track as part of an Incredibles ride counts, but an indoor-only Peoplemover does not.

(3) Credible Slovak media outlets or international news organizations report that a Slovak journalist or opposition politician has been criminally charged in connection with the assassination attempt on Slovak PM Robert Fico before June 15, 2024. Alternatively, the resolution will also be YES if relevant Slovak institutions (e.g., the public prosecutor's office, courts, police, and similar authorities) issue a statement to that effect.

All three conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the International Seabed Authority Secretary-General Michael Lodge be re-elected for a third term in the July elections?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise it will resolve **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Michael Lodge being re-elected as ISA Secretary-General, will Iran's Guardian Council approve Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's candidacy for president?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. The International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections.

2. Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

If Michael Lodge is not re-elected for a third term, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given Michael Lodge is re-elected as ISA Secretary-General and Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is approved as a presidential candidate, will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) Michael Lodge is re-elected as the Secretary-General of the International Seabed Authority in the July elections, and (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of approved presidential candidates. Then, will at least 24 world records be broken during the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: (1) Resolves Yes if credible sources report Michael Lodge's re-election. (2) Resolves Yes if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in the approved candidates list.
- For the outcome: Resolves Yes if 24 or more world records are broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Michael Lodge be re-elected as ISA Secretary-General in July elections, (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad be included in Iran's Guardian Council's approved presidential candidates list, and (3) at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: (1) The question will resolve **Yes** if the International Seabed Authority (ISA) and/or credible sources report that the incumbent Secretary-General Michael Lodge has been elected for a third term in the July elections. Otherwise it will resolve **No**. (2) This question resolves **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election. (3) This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Conditional on an athlete winning more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, will UCLA hold its in-person graduation ceremonies on June 14, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between an athlete winning multiple tennis medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics and UCLA holding its in-person graduation ceremonies as scheduled on June 14, 2024. 

Condition: The condition is met if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

Outcome: The outcome resolves **Yes** if the University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 at the specified times and locations on June 14, 2024. The ceremonies must all occur at Pauley Pavilion and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics and UCLA holds its scheduled in-person commencement ceremonies on June 14, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.
2. The University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 scheduled for June 14, 2024, at the Pauley Pavilion at the specified times (11 AM, 3 PM, and 7 PM). Each ceremony must occur at the specified location and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time.

Given these conditions, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) An athlete wins more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (b) UCLA holds its scheduled in-person, university-wide graduation commencement ceremonies on June 14, 2024, and (c) Israel expands its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) An athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA) holds all three of its main in-person college commencement ceremonies for the graduating Class of 2024 scheduled for June 14, 2024, at the Pauley Pavilion at the specified times (11 AM, 3 PM, and 7 PM). Each ceremony must occur at the specified location and begin within 1 hour of the scheduled starting time. The question resolves as **No** if either an athlete does not win at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics or if any of UCLA's ceremonies does not meet the specified criteria (e.g., does not begin within an hour of the scheduled time, is moved to another location, or is held entirely online).

(c) The [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.
